												We asked the admin on a server if he could help us out by spawning us some bones for our monument, since the server would crash if we killed an animal. (this has since been fixed)The admin spawned a bear right next to our camp, in which the bear decided we looked very tasty. The bear stampeeded across our nice neat rows of houses, attacking us and killing us mercicely. Eventually we chased the bear down the coast and beat it to death with shovels. After my team mates and I killed the bear, we proceded to all stand around and argue over who would get it.A fight ensued during which my character fell unconscious. My team mates then decided to either A) kill me with a shovel and save the effort or reviving me, or B) beat my broken bones back into place with a hammer.11/10 would listen to my team mates discuss how to torture my unconscious body again.ACTUAL REVIEW:GAMEPLAYOkay so this is a bloody fantastic game, you start out on an island with absolutly nothing. Combat is really fun and reminds me of Age of Chivary. There are so many options it is absolutly insane. They all work together flawlessly and end up making for a great gameplay, be it bloody combat or building yourself a settlement with friends. Key point about this game, YOU NEED FRIENDS OR YOU WILL DIE. It is very hard to solo this game. Almost impossible, I have not seen someone do it unless they steal/kill for their possesions. GRAPHICSD11 just got released two days ago, and already all of the graphical glitches I have seen have been fixed. This game runs very smoothly on ultra with my gtx 970. High settings I was running it at almsot 100 FPS. Even at high settings however the terrain looks absolutly beautifal.

number of helpful: 14 of 17 people (82%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								I don't know where to start! Life Is Feudal is by far one of the BEST sandboxes ive ever played. Its got unique systems and mechanics for crafting, forging, cooking, alchemy and other things like terraforming and logging. ALL of which have their own skill sets and levelling so you won't progess skills the same way twice, or find the same items & ingredients in the same place which is a nice touch. Depending on which server you are on, there are also variable stat & skill caps this means that if you specialise in a certain skill it can determine how useful you will be in building settlments, and once reach the leveling limit of one skill, thats it Reach the stat and skill caps and leveling up will be a distant memory as they will become rare occurences. This means prople of different skills will have to work together and pool resources and skills, especially if a battle takes place in nearby settlements/towns and repairs have to be made quickly. For example, one person of your group/guild might be a master blacksmith, while another will be a master Logger, so choosing which skill to level completely is CRUCIAL.You basically start the game with nothing but food scraps and rags for clothes, so your first instinct is to create primitive gear which can be done quite quicker than you would expect. As you start to meet random people in your travels, you will also start to learn of the surrondings more and where developments have been started. I remember one time where I spawned into the world and I basically turned right and saw an ENTIRE FORTRESS built far off into the distance on the other side of an island, and as I explored around there was the odd camp/shack then a small town where groups have formed a guild. It cleary shows the sheer scope of how important working with people is in this game.Another strong point is the combat mechanics, if you have played the Mount & Blade games you will feel right at home here with the directional movements and there are even group formations to be used in a battle! Formations like shield walls, phalanx/wedge, and defensive circle formations can be applied and changed on the fly in mid battle, VERY useful for when 2 armies or more are battling it out.The final thing you will notice (and the most notable when you start the game and spawn into a world) is the graphics. At the moment there are Direct x 7 and 9 graphics, DO NOT let the discussions and reviews fool you! This game is a visual master piece considering the DX7 and 9 graphics closely resemble TES4: Oblivion's graphics, but with the fast approaching release date the Direct x 11 graphics will make this one of the most beautiful medieval themed sandboxes ever made!Overall i give this game a 8.5/10 and thats just at an EARLY ACEESS point of veiw as Bitbox are at the moment of smoothing everything out for the release and beginning to implement future features upon post release. This has been one of the most comprehensive, immersive and challenging games ive played to date. Looking forwand to more! 11/10 would recommend this game to those who have never played sandboxes or similar themed games like MMORPG's as it is worth the experience.

number of helpful: 20 of 28 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								What happens if you take a healthy chunk of Rust, add sprinkles of Wurm Online, flavour it with bits of Mount & Blade and top it all off with a mixture of Ultima, Darkfall and EVE Online? Whether your answer is "A flavourless, chunky paste" or "A gourmet masterpiece", both have relevance when it comes to BitBox Ltd.'s first major project Life is Feudal (LiF). Yet still, while combining the well-known aspects of games like those mentioned above, the devlopers claim that LiF is absolutely unique and are working on some features to set it apart from its main competitors.In essence, LiF is a medieval themed sandbox online RPG, including all the survival and crafting mechanics the industry is so crazed about as of late. Familiarly, you are thrown into an immense world with nothing but some dirty clothes, provisions to last you a few days and your bare hands to help you survive. The now well honed instincts of a survival game expert should kick in immediately and drive you to forage for food, look for some basic resources to craft primitive tools with - you know the drill all too well. Where LiF differs is its skill system. Every character has a set of attributes and skills which will determine his ability to pretty much do anything, from a "Nature Lore" skill that will help you find more edibles on the ground to an array of crafting skills such as Carpentry, Masonry or Smelting. LiF is not intended to be played all by yourself and you will quickly find out why, as there is a skillcap in place, preventing you from being perfect at everything. Not long into the game you will have to decide which paths to go down and which ones to leave to other players. Eventually, your quaint community will should consist of a number of specialists working together. Building said community is one of the key features of LiF, as it offers every player total control over his environment. You can terraform the landscape, flatten out areas or dig up moats for your improvised stronghold, mine for minerals in underground tunnels (the world is voxel-based, much like Minecraft but with smooth edged) or build structures - watchtowers, shacks or entire castle towns, provided you have the resources for it and architects skilled enough to build something more complex than an axe made of a stick, plantfibre and flintstone. Another important skill-tree offers various combat skills, increasing your efficiency with certain weapons, armour or even horses and mounted combat (not yet implemented). This will help you fend off agressive animals or indeed other players, as LiF features full PvP and looting. While there are some penalties to going on a murder spree, it is an option and you will surely see more foe than friend. To help bring structure into this potentially chaotic environment, an upcoming feature will include land claims for individual players and for player-owned factions. These lands will be completely safe, but can be contested and captured in PvP faction vs faction wars. Three faction types are planned to exist: Bands/Orders, Fiefs and Kingdoms, the difference being size, influence over other factions and the amount of claimable land. This feature, however, will NOT be part of the game you see linked to this very review. LiF will effectively be released in two different versions: LiF: Your Own (reviewed, current build) and LiF: MMO. The latter will, according to the developers, feature a true massively multiplayer online persistent world with more than 10.000 players, a much bigger world and many features not available in LIF: Your Own, but is still well beyond our reach. LiF: Your Own meanwhile features dedicated serverplay with a maximum of 64 players playing on a 3x3km map."Life is Feudal is a Unique Sandbox MMORPG." is the claim made by the developers. Does LiF live up to it? While the current Early Access release build is actually still in early alpha, it is plain to see the effort behind the project, as well as the sheer amount of features available now and the even bigger number of things "not yet implemented", but already planned (horses, deeper combat, even more crafting). "Life is Feudal" is furthermore not just the title of this game, but one of its main directives. Survival is hard, especially when you're on your own. Learning skills takes time and dedication. Death is best avoided. If all of this sounds appealing to you, giving this game a chance would definitely be recommended. Be warned, though, because the current build (20/9/14) is pretty much as early as Early Access gets, so you will run into bugs, balancing issues and many buttons with the "Not yet implemented"-stamp on them. Buying the game now means you are willing to help fund the further development of this title and be eligible to offer your own feedback.So tighten your straps, pull up those pontaloons and train your swordarm, things are about to get medieval up in here!

content:
Posted: October 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								I enjoy ARK, minecraft, KSP, and Neverwinter. (Just to give you an idea of my preferences.)This game *does* have some bugs remaining. I had some sort of memory leak (or other compouning problem) and sound issues after playing for awhile. It became unbearable after something like 5 or 6 hours (but my system is pretty high-quality, so your mileage may vary). However, a simple restart of the game solved the problem and only took a minute. This is not game-breaking.I love this game... but it won't be for everyone.Some things to note:A) Most servers use conservative server settings that are pretty close to default.B) At default settings, things in this game can take a long time and a lot of effort to achieve. You'll have to earn it.C) With default settings, you almost cannot survive alone. (Farming/nature lore can both allow you to forage for food, but cooking requires multiple skill sets that will almost undoubtedly require multiple participants. If you plan on jumping into the game with no friends to help you and with no idea what you're doing... you will probably fail.D) Some servers have much more newb-friendly settings... look for high level/stat caps and high resource gather multipliers/exp multipliers.E) Part of the appeal of this game *IS* the fact that it takes so much effort to be successful... reaching a milestone can be very rewarding. I'm looking forward to getting my first shack built.F) There's a lot to learn about this game, the wiki is your friend. G) Something that I had to find out through experience and lots of looking online: Many abilities require advanced skills with a skill level of 0... but they must still be unlocked to be used, and many require lots of skill levels in a prerequisite skill to be unlocked. IE: cutting billets for cooking fuel requires lvl 0 carpentry, but carpentry doesn't unlock until lvl 60 logging.H) Working with terrain is tedious and very time consuming... don't plan on getting in here and levelling mountains like in minecraft... you'll be digging the rest of your life... it's just implausible.I) The skill system is very detailed and random events can occur. I cut my hand while trying to forage and it bled for like 10 minutes. Not life threatening... but interesting. This game feels kindof like Neverwinter or D&D meets ARK set in medieval times.J) There's no magic (although prayer can have supernatural effects [including teleportation]).So far this is just a description of the main points of the game as I see it at the moment. Now for the good and bad.GOOD:-Devs are pretty active.-Plenty of servers with a variety of settings.-Very playable, few bugs.-Very unique.-Highly replayable. (partly because of how limited you usually are in character development)-Very conducive to roleplay. (Though it's often not required/expected)-The music. (I love it, totally my own opinion)BAD:-A little expensive for an alpha game.-Graphics are very mix-n-match. (IE: character model looks amazing, but the hair models look atrocious... kinda weird)-I love the focus on team-play... however, there *needs* to be a single skill set that will allow you to survive in the wilderness on your own. Sure, you won't be eating cake... and it's likely you'll spend most of your time hunting/fishing/gathering to support yourself... but it seems unrealistic that you can't have a single survival skill that enables you to build a simple campfire, hunt/fish, and grill up a bit of dinner. This could also make for a new skill tree leading into "scouting" skills.

number of helpful: 28 of 43 people (65%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 9, 2016
												(eng) (рус)This is basically your collective farm simulator, an online 'Crazy Farmer' time management game enriched with something like 'Mount&Blade'/'War of The Roses' fighting system. It's got nice interface, comprehensive tutorial and decent engine, and as an old 'M&B' fan I felt myself almost at home here right away.. until I tried game hunting. Man, all the animations are so clunky it's painful to see in 2016! I've been playing 'M&B' since almost 10 years ago (alfa) and now I don't see any substantial progress in that respect. Stupid horses and then that elk.. I feel pity for them. Ok, I'll take a deep breath and tell you how it was.The tutorial said I should select a patch of soil and choose 'search for peaceful animal tracks'. There was nothing. Being a city dweller I still surmised to look at a nearby lake's shore. I found tracks of cloven hoof, they appeared at the ground as highlighted texture spots leading to the forest. I followed that curved line and it seemed funny how it passed right through some large trees, that's where I started to feel suspitious about the software. After a while I spotted a couple of horses.. which should be odd-toed. Eh, who needs that foolish botany anyway? I closed on them, they just lied down before me. I thought it will be an easy task, maybe a part of tutorial. My axe hit the nearest one in the head for no visible effect, it jumped up and ran away, but not far. I started chasing it to the lake, then to the mountain, it went through trees not noticing them and ploughed into uneven ground. On our way we also spooked an elk and some geese. I switched to chasing the elk. I managed to make a slingshot while it waited for me nearby. The animals also lacked animations, as well as the brains, they seemed to follow just one algorythm - kept some distance. After I had hit the mammal for the 20th time with a stone it turned on me and horned me till I fell unconscious.. without any animation.The game is not finished, it's totally unpolished, crude as a stone axe, and it's technological basis already feels outdated! All in all, if you are very patient I strongly advise you to go build yourself a real house in the woods instead of playing this. For others there are much more cheerful middle-age lifestyle simulators on the market.-------------------------------------------------------------------------В основе своей это ваш симулятор колхоза, многопользовательская "Бешеная ферма" про управление временем, обогащенная чем-то типа боевой системы "Седла и клинка"/"Войны роз". Тут приятный интерфейс, понятное обучение и неплохой движок, и как старый фанат "СиК" я почувствовал себя сразу почти как дома... пока не попробовал охотиться на дичь. Боже, анимация так груба, что больно смотреть в 2016 году! Я начинал играть в "СиК" почти 10 лет назад (с альфы), и вот я не вижу серьезного прогресса в этом отношении. Глупые лошади, и потом этот лось... мне жалко их. Ладно, давайте я сделаю вдох и расскажу по порядку.В обучении сказали выделить клочок земли и выбрать "поиск следов мирного животного". Ничего не было. Будучи гордским жителем, я все же сообразил поискать на берегу ближайшего озера. Нашел следы раздвоенных копыт, они появились на земле в виде подсвеченных текстурных пятен и вели в лес. Последовав по этой извилистой линии, я порадовался тому, как она проходила прямо сквозь большие деревья, тут я начал что-то подозревать об этой программе. Потом я заметил впереди пару лошадей... которые по идее непарнокопытные. Э, да кому нужна эта дурацкая ботаника? Я приблизился к ним, они просто улеглись передо мной. Я подумал, что это будет легко, как этап обучения.Топор ударил ближайшую в голову без видимых последствий, она вскочила и убежала, но не далеко. Я за ней к озеру, потом на гору, она неслась сквозь деревья и тонула в неровностях почвы. По дороге вспугнули лося и гусей. Я переключился на лося. Умудрился смастерить пращу, пока он меня ждал неподалеку. Животным не хватало анимаций, равно как и мозга, похоже, у них был единственный алгоритм - держать некоторое расстояние. Когда я попал в эту тушу камнем в двадцатый раз, он развернулся и бросился меня бодать без всякой анимации, я упал в обиорок.Игра не закончена, совершенно не доведена до ума, груба как каменный топор, а ее техническая база уже смотрится устаревшей! В общем, если вы очень терпеливы, настоятельно вам советую построить себе настоящий домик в лесу вместо этой игры. Для прочих на рынке представлены гораздо более веселые симуляторы средневековой житухи.

												Well playing this game around 6 to 8 months ago for around 40 hours, i loved the game. The problems I see right now are: 1. The biggest and most annoying one is GUI glitches. It makes your character wig out,trees look like there circling your screen along with grass, and your game crashes for no reason because of optimization issues. 2. You can't seem to stay in a server more than 10 minutes with out crashing for some reason.It just won't keep you connected. 3. Developers released it before it was ready. The really need to fix the graphics and stability beforethey should consider this a released game. They really need to get a beta test going for stability patches. Out side of those 3 major issues I've encountered, the game is great. However they really need to step up thereoptimization before getting there mmo out. I would hate to see that mmo version littered with the current bugs on the private servers ruin it before it even got a chance to get off the ground. As of right now, I can't reccomend this game. As I've seen others state, im kind of annoyed at the way there putting this game on sale. content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
												I've been following and playing this game for quite some time now and it has certainly come a long way fromwhen I first saw it.With Alpha and Beta testing for the MMO server happening, this games final iteration is quickly closing in but I'm more than certain it's not the last.It's the first survival crafting game I've seen that takes the right approach to encourage cooperation. Just throwing zombies everywhere and a food and drink meter isn't enough, Rust or Dayz is a prime example of that.Sure it is technically feasible to build everything on your own, at a very basic level. The skill system makes it so that you can only become proficient enough in only a small handful of professions, trying to master all is impossible and will make you lose skill in others. This makes it so that everyone who plays can pick their role and that role will be valueable and needed. You then go find others with different skills, you work together, build together, fight together, survive. Eventually you get yourself a nice little village going and attract more people, it just goes on from there.Arbitrary rating 7/10This version is technically for private servers, the devs true vision is seeing this at an MMORPG scale.

content:
Posted: November 19, 2015
												If you want an in depth experience with an incredibly deep crafting system, this game is for you. If you are looking for a quick fix, easy to play, low commitment game, then you are probably looking in the wrong place.Not sure why there are negative reviews popping up for this game during release. Are there issues? From what I have seen online, sure. Are the developers working to fix these issues, absolutely, just go take a peek at the news feed. I must be one of the extremely lucky ones that is only having a few minor texture issues, and the developer is aware of that and is working on that as well.This game is one of the best looking, most in depth games I have come across in a long while, and I'm extremely happy I stumbled upon it. If you are concerned about the issues they are having at launch, just keep an eye on the news feed and they will let you know when they have come upon a fix for them. Other than that, this developer is actually listening to the community and working on player suggestions to add to an already pretty amazing game. The reality is, this was an early access game that made it to release, and that in itself is a rare and amazing thing, Bitbox should be commended for the time and effort they have and continue to put into a game that they are clearly as passionate about as a lot of the people who play it are.

Early Access Review
								First off, I am really enjoying this game and from the different posts, reddit's and everything else this game seems to have some awesome features still to come.I have read through many posts and from what i can tell, the people who say this game sucks should go back to playing MMO # 327 or whatever generic title suits you.  This game is a survival/crafting/building/pvp/pve game.  I have to laugh when i heard someone say this game sucks because it is grindy, then they go into a "better" MMO and jump into an area with high mob repawn to "power level".  You guys crack me up.  Yes, you need to build, gather, transport goods to your base, plow land, seed, etc. etc., but what MMO exsists to this day that doesnt need some type of investment of time or energy.  Just like any game, you get out what you put into it.Anyway, to my point, this game is exploring down an uncharted path with some very new and unique ideas and even more improvments and twists on old ones.For those that dont take the time to read, this game will be off dedicated/restricted servers and the ultimate plan is for it to be an MMO.  It is not a full MMO right now, so dont expect it to be, I think of LIF YO as an early Alpha for the MMO.Buy it, you know you want too, time to let go of the standard MMO model.

number of helpful: 21 of 31 people (68%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								( wrote this before release )Lemme' tell you this.I am currently in actual testing of this product.This is LiF: YO, not the actual MMO yet. This is a very much scaled down version for continued development. You will have the ability to do many of the things coming to the MMO, some much sooner than later, some not for a bit of time yet. No, I am not at liberty to share much info, being a humble test guy, I will say this.. this is going to be the 'must have' of Medieval style games. No magic, no orcs, no elves, just a pretty much true to life feudal world, where you can be literally anything by striving for it. The game has open PvP but with a price. If you feel the need to be a bandit then thats fine, but every action will mark you, killing an innocent will cost you until your a marked criminal with no coming back, and if you die, you lose massive skills, whereas being a highwayman and just robbing people will only mark you as a thug. Meanwhile fighting and being a hero in the warfare will gain you status, along with helping out folks. So its pretty much set like real life, you can be / do what you want, but actions have consequences. It also requires you realize your not alone in the world. You cant do it all. Everyone serves a role, from the butcher, the baker to the candlestick maker, even the village monk / priest, or gaurd. IE I am not a fighter myself, so I really rely on the combat guys, but they rely on others to cook for them. etc. This is shaping up to be great!

Posted: April 26, 2016
												Life is feudal is a grinding game, everything takes a significant investment of time and patience so this is not a casual game.  If you're looking for something to do for half an hour before the wife and kids get in and ruin your afternoon then stick to CoD.  If you have no wife or kids or job and just sit around playing pc games maybe smoking some pot (living the dream)  then get this!  One of the nicest looking survival sims it provides an almost unparalleled satisfaction when you finally get your tiny shack,  kiln or Manor house complete.  It also has an active player base and plenty of servers so you should find one near you with ease

Early Access Review
								So, i've been playing Life is Feudal for about 100 hours on a dedicated server. i want to start by saying how surprised i am to read so many bad reviews. This is the most extensive detailed and feature full survival game i have ever played. I have played all of them. that said i hope to see the community grow and for people to give the game a chance. there were a few points where i just wanted to give up because every takes so long and when you think your getting somewhere you realize you have so much work to do yet. but it's rewarding as hell. i can hop on to a rust server and have everything in the game in about 1 hour. lol. this is laughable compaired to LIF. if you like instant gratification this game is not for you. if you like a world that is truley crafted by you and the other players and want to work for what you get in the game, it's for you...

Posted: September 3, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game takes a lot of patience. Don't buy it if you aren't prepared to put time and effort into learning the complex crafting and combat system. The wiki does a fairly good job of helping you to understand the game more. All in all, I have spent 1000 hours of my life playing this game. I love the free build system, love the Guild Claims and thankful I can actaually play a female character now instead of only being able to play Baldy. This game can be confusing as hell when you first start, and it takes a little while to get used to the grind. Definitely a game to play with a guild rather than alone if you want to get anywhere with it. Love the communities that grow on the servers. Would recommend this game to anyone that doesn't mind a couple of annoying bugs and wants to have fun working things out and muck around with mates.

number of helpful: 12 of 15 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game is very interesting. While yes it is one of those "survival sandbox" games which has (until 4 days after this review) been in early access, it is also one of the most original and expansive of those on offer.The game itself has managed a wonderful feeling of immersion in its own world/lore. When you play it you can be quite content with the feeling of actually being in the world your character is surrounded by. I will now break this review down into a few sections:Gameplay:This game takes a long time. That is a key point, do not expect to have a massive medieval castle and town within 5 hours of playing the game. Large parts involve effectively grinding (!FLUX! - players will know) to find the resources you need to construct/create the buildings/items you want. However teamwork is amazingly useful because it reduces the time needed to perform many actions. Such that imagine 1 person takes 1 hour to perform an action, 2 people would then take less than half an hour to do the same action.Also as this is a survival game you need to gather food to survive. This is relatively simple if you have found a few reliably good quality apple trees. You will also need to 'rest' your character occasionally if performing tough work such as terraforming or construction etc.This leads me onto another important point regarding skill progression. The game is designed, as I've said previously and as you will hear through this review, for teamplay. A limitation imposed by this is such that you cannot be an expert at everything! You have a limited number of skill points to distribute around the various skills (which unlock in a skill-tree type fashion). As you perform actions these skill points will be added to your skill in that action up to your limit (you can 're-spec' by downgrading your skills if needed). Because of this you will need a group to play with unless you set your game/server to have custom (default is 800 I think) levels of skill points.Graphics:This game has looked absolutely fine throughout its development but its looming DX11 release looks incredible from what we've seen thus far. Other than this I cannot comment much on this point other than it runs very well without many framerate dips etc. so seems quite optimised.Music/Audio:The sound quality is great with well recorded clips for all actions and a nice atmospheric background soundtrack, although if playing for many hours at a time it can get a little repetitive.I'm not used to writing reviews (this is my first so I know I will have missed a lot) so please don't hate :P

content:
Posted: November 10, 2015
												I've played plenty of survival games in my time, and this is hands down my favorite. The overall feel of a server's community entirely revolves around human nature. Some people want to be barbarians, some want to be bandits, a lot more just want to coexist. In the end, your experiences depend on which you choose.Barbarians (people who run around naked screaming obscenities ad decapitating deer) tend to add a bit of comedic relief to the trying environment that is LiF, but may also come and burn your house down and steal your chickens.Bandits come in two flavors. They either roleplay and hold you up much like a common highwayman, or run around in packs of 4+ and just kill some poor naked ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ under the illusion that they have gear worth taking.Coexisting countrymen constantly care for each other like cousins. The core concept is to cooperate in a calculated campaign of carpentry, construction, calipers, and cooking. This competing collection of corroborative characters can, and commonly do, cause caustious- ok enough with the alliteration.tl;dr If you aren't a bard or bandit you typicaly form a group and make friends through helping each other build a small settlement. If you are like me, you tend to do this with around 15 other people, the majority of which are on Teamspeak. The few times you get attacked either end in everyone dying or some lone wannabe bandit getting chased off by a dozen angry, heavily-armed and armoured peasants weilding the fruits of their labor as weapons of death.To be fair, i have had my troubles wanting to play this game but this is for personal reasons. I can not handle stress due to a medical condition I have. This being said, you will stress a lot in this game. (Is that naked man on a horse really a bandit with his armour deequipped to lull us into a false sense of security, or is he some scrub fresh spawn that got lucky and found a horse already?) These are the questions that can get people killed, or get people killed. It is very rare for most people to trust one another on a server with known bandits and barbarians as they recruit more as the server grows. In the end though, this game is a delight to have in my steam library and I'm happy to have spent $40 on it.Please read the comments to get a more updated look at my experience with the game as it develops.

number of helpful: 13 of 17 people (76%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 22, 2015
Early Access Review
								One word.  AWESOME.  This game is being designed to be effectively limitless in possibilities, realistic ones at that, and the current limits, considering it is still early access, are constantly being expanded.  Great appearance helps as well.  PvP is fun.The one note that I will make is that this game is not for the weak of heart.  To be successful takes a LOT of time and effort as well as a group of friends.  It is incredibly difficult to setup a successful community with a cooperative group of 10 people, and even more difficult to do on your own, though it can be done.  This isn't the result of a game flaw, this is how the game is intended to be.  Forest disappears very quickly once you start constructing even small buildings, as the materials gained from harvesting things like trees is pretty realistic.  Unlike other games, new trees don't just sprout up in their place, you need to plant more.  Planting is easy, but even with ideal weather conditions it takes real life days (up to a week I think) for the trees to mature into a useful, harvestable material.  This is just one example.  This game is difficult, and it is meant to be.  One HUGE advantage from this is that there are far fewer♥♥♥♥♥hats that just run around abusing people for the sake of doing so, and most of the time if someone does that they are banned.  The rationale is that if you want your character to be a bandit and steal from others, that is fine.  But if you're just going to grief people, that drives players off, resulting in smaller/fewer groups building on a server which ends up in server death.  The requirement of cooperation really encourages players to respect one another.  Players are also less likely to risk losing things, such as weapons, attacking other people unless there is a good reason, as replacing them takes a significant amount of time, work, and help from other people.If you truly enjoy survival this game is for you.  You can always setup a local game and adjust the difficulty to be easy to do on your own, but most servers do NOT do that.Definitely a great game with a great future.

content:
Posted: August 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								I bought and played for a 2 hour test and found it very in depth and the community very friendly. It requires a lot of time however, and can be very grindy. You start off with a small amount of food and some rag clothing. From there it is up to you to start developing your character how you want. You can prospect the ground for ore, get the bark off a tree, collect sticks, search for edible food on the ground, etcHowever, actions take quite a bit o f time and do not always increase your skill.Here's one example. When you search the ground for food the action takes some time and often turns out no results. Tha's because action success is based on random chance.  If your action is not succesful you don’t gain skill. If the actions is successful you do gain skill, but you don’t improve your chances of being successful in the future.I posted on the fourm that I wonder why games like this are so mundane when they could easily take place in a much more imaginitive world, and within 5 min the Dev banned me with no warning.Here's the post that got me banned: https://sites.google.com/site/thebannedpost/NOTE: This review got me perma-banned. The Devs tried to censor this review, but I guess Steam wouldn't let them, since my only "threat" was that I would be writing a negative review.The personal attacks in their response below are simply unprofessional, and show an immature attitude towards players with whom they have a disagreement.

content:
Posted: December 17, 2015
												Life is Feudal is by far one of the most grindy games I've ever played, but its also one of the BEST games I've ever played. And heres why: So Im running along a beach one day and I see a Norsemen hacking away at the ground... Making a mine. I ask if I can help and he says "Sure". About an hour and a half later we have successfully tunneled well into the ground, finally uncovering the prize: Iron ore. As we are rejoiceing about advancing into the iron age. We turn around and see that our tunnel has collapsed and we cant get out... So we try the pray abilty and it does not work, we try despretrly to mine our way out but we cant, there was no place to but the stuff we were mining out therefore there was no way to get out. We even try to call an admin to get us out but had no luck. About an hour later I decide that I will kill him and he will come back and mine me out. So I hack him to death and he respawns, but apprantly he spawned on the very south tip of the map... Seems legit. Even though we were in the north. So another 30 mins goes by and finally he arrives and then I think to myself "It would be pretty funny if I tryed prayed again and it spawned me home" BOOM I hit 7 and I spawned at my house.             10/10 would get stuck in tunnel with a harry Norsemen again.

content:
Posted: July 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								Developer's financing shenanigans aside, LiF:YO isn't all that bad by itself.The game world is somewhat nice and immersive and there is a rather large range of occupations to be had.In-game progression is however really REALLY slow (though I find it make achieving one's goal all the more rewarding).While social interactions are mandatory to advance, (unless you have multiple accounts) I found I could get fairly high in the progression tree by myself.Where the game ultimately fail for me is in the painfully slow rate of development progress or I should say lack off combined with the high price they ask for it.Combat system which would give an incentive to attack/defend resources is mostly broken, decay system has not really been addressed properly, UI is terrible, there is no natural way (short of an admin intervention) to fill trenches and holes dug by players and as of yet, no officials servers. Which mean all that unless the server is yours, there's no guarantee your hard work will still be there tomorrow or the day after.With hindsight, I feel my time and money would have been better spent somewhere else.

content:
Posted: November 20, 2015
												Age of Empires - in the first person! --Reviewed at 18 hours--If you are in doubt about this game, I urge you to just jump in and YouTube & Wiki willing you will enjoy this game!There is little to no tutorial and things may frustrate you, I would urge you to push past this and open up a world of possibilitiesNot many games get 15 hours of straight play; Life is Feudal did it for me.The game based in a medieval era urges the players not to play as a simulator but to think logically and forward think for your new character and live in the world grinding out skills to reach the next skill type that you need to progress your settlement. (So yes it is a simulator but not to the level that we have previously known it, you get invested in your players as you roleplay out their lives and complete many, many tasks)As a SP game it will be hard to manage your land and its needs along with other players in the MP realm... You may choose to be a travelling tradesmen specialised in your skill trading for what you need or you might choose to join a group and move forward in leaps and bounds for the greater good of the group... However be forewarned, as you grow into a large group the needs change and your supply of food and mining rewards may begin to find a low and risk everything that you have so far worked so valiantly for!The depth of this game is astounding, the devs listen to the gitch reports and actively seek to fix them with frequent patches. Yes glitches do occur and there are other things that just don't match up; this game has come a long way from its alpha release in many ways and its current gameplay today proves just that.The question is are you willing to fork out your own investment into a character and help etich them them into history.10/10 for such vast gaming ideas8(9) for current game state due to some stability issues8.5 for graphics - this game is beautiful, however Nvidia uses may struggle; the Devs use ATI.8 for sound - mesmerizing10 for the right server and community inputBuy the game if you are on the fence;buy the game if you doubt the glitches;buy the game if you like medieval games;buy the game if you like want minecraft with REAL graphics;buy the game if you like Age of Empires, it's it in first person!

content:
Posted: July 4, 2015
Early Access Review
								After spending quite a few hours straight since I bought it, I think this game is a great game. However, there are flaws that I must state in the current version of the game.Pro's:The game is very community friendly. You don't have to worry about getting non-stop attacked or killed. Most servers don't allow random and no reason killing. Where as in games like DayZ, or Rust you have people who just constantly kill for no reason.This game is very relaxing. Those nights you get off from work and don't feel like just running around and gunning people down in FPS games. This game is great as to where you can just sit, listen to the very relaxing and beautiful music, and build while maybe watching a movie or something.Can do and build what you want, and how you want. If you want to take a week or so to build a huge underground fort, you can. If you want to build a stronghold, you can. Or perhaps a beach farm, you can. You can pretty much do what ever you want in this game, if you have the time and patience.Great and beautiful graphics. They are just stunning and beautiful to sit and stare at. Very fleshed out as well.-----------------------------------Cons:Optimization is not great. If you run it on medium or low, you can roughly get around 20-30 FPS with a mid tier PC. If you want to run anything above that, you'll need to have the most modern and updated gaming computer. Even then, there's no telling if you'll get anything above 30fps.Worlds are just dead, and rely too much on player to player interaction. The servers are not dead, just the world feels really empty. There's hardly any wildlife, and the map is so big, you'll rarely come across other players, even on 64 player servers filled. The building feature even revolves way too much on player interaction, because how many items you need to build certain things, and how long they take to aquire them.Obtaining weapons take a very long time. You can almost immediatly get tools, and a sling with rocks, however if you want to use a bow, crossbow or sword it, takes a whole town to wield them, because first you have to build a smithy, which requires all these other objects that require skills, and the skill like contruction take a very long time to level up if you're by yourself.The requirement for a friend/s to play with you. If you want to get anywhere without taking a few weeks to build a small town, you need atleast a friend or two. The length it takes to collect items from things like tree's, rocks, ores, and even food is so long, and most items you get is only 1 every 15-20 seconds, which is not a lot seeming as how you need around 10 things you may or may not get from searching for a simple fence.Some skills like fishing is very obsolete because of how they were implemented. I spent over 45 minutes trying to catch one fish, because somehow in 1,000BC fish are so rare. Then when you get a fish and cook it, your campfire somehow gets broken, and the fish only gives you about 20 hunger regen, when something like an apple which is pretty common and you collect around 23 in 5 seconds gives like 17-20 hunger regen.Hunting is also pretty obsolete because of how hard/long it takes to get a bow and how little wildlife there is.------------------------------------------------Anyhow my total ranking is, 7.5/10. There's a lot of potential here, and I hope we get more patches before the september release.

content:
Posted: June 17, 2016
												as much time as I put into this game, I thought I'd be writing a positive review but that is not the case. I had my own monument and land, I had some of the basic buildings like a stable, a barn and a couple houses. It was fun when i started but as I played I saw others come and go constantly, not many came back to play after one or two times of playing, so unless your IRL friends are going to play with you, assume you'll do a lot of building alone or join up an already built kingdom. Also, horses are a problem. Don't run through trees because you will be slowed down and the game is likely to crash. This happened to me multiple times and I saw it happen to people on my land as well, almost every time I played. If you are on a horse and crash on someone else's land, and don't get back on within a couple minutes consider the horse theirs now unless you are someone like myself who would in fact return the horse to the rightful owner. In addition to those issues, I constantly had problems with my drying racks glitching, unable to dry animal skins so they would just be sitting there useless until the server refreshed. speaking of servers refreshing this means your herb gardens are going to too, so you have to time it just right to get your herbs that take 6 hours to produce. I tried 3 times and every time I didn't get my herbs to make flux so I said forget that and just started trading other kingdoms for flux. Its a fairly decent game but I just couldn't recommend it, maybe the MMO will be better but the game as is, no. just no.

												Probably the most potential for any early release title I've ever owned.  I picked this up as part of a humble bundle after having it on my wishlist for a year or so, and I regret not buying it outright sooner.  Progression is slow and painstaking, but in a way that is highly rewarding and meaningful.  MMO beta is just about under way now, which I am anticipating more than BF1 or Civ6 for 2016 releases.There are a fair share of growing pains in the 'your own' hosted server community, and some less than admirable server admins out there, but none the less this is an awesome game that you should play if you have any interest in RPGs or survival games.  Highly recommend

												This game is fantastic! Its a very well made game for its current state and is very fun to play with friends. Overall I give it a 9/10    - When the full MMO comes out (or if they put in dragons) this game is an easy 10/10 and would be my pick for Game of the Year

content:
Posted: December 27, 2015
												I bought LiF:YO during EA and it was such a bore. I uninstalled and walked away within two hours. However, I decided to give it another try after it hit full release, and I've got to admit I was pleasantly surprised!LiF:YO has come a long, long way from it's EA days. It is still a grind, but not in the "oh I have to grab 200 stones to make this" but in the "holy crap, this is a hardcore survival game!". You are not handed items, you are not handed stats, you have to earn everything you want. You want to craft an iron sword? Start prospecting, mining, and smelting. You want to plant an apple tree? Start gathering plants, sowing seeds, and tilling the land. This is a game you spend many hours on just to get started. While this may sound like a negative, it gives you a sense of accomplishment that many survival games have long forgotten.

												Alright, first things first, I returned the game. I know what youre think, "Why are you giving it a thumbs up then?" Because, its a good game, its just not my game. This game is a very time consuming game, more so than Civilization III. I can handle playing Reign of Kings or Rust, but this game is too complicated and too slow for my taste. Lets go over how its somewhat of a decent game, It reminds me of DnD (Dungeons and Dragons). The actions that your perform on a tree alone, show how indepth the game really gets. You can rip the bark off, see if its a fruit bearing tree, break a branch off, or chop it down. Its really a work of beauty to see that kind of detail in a game like this. All in all, i think if i had a better computer for this, i would totally play more but after two hours, i gave up. Maybe one you guys will enjoy it.This is a post release review, just so you know. Never played early access.

content:
Posted: November 9, 2015
Early Access Review
								Let me start by saying that for more than 10 years, I've been waiting for a sandbox that would rival Ultima Online. Nothing could ever quite match up. I seriously think this might be the one. And that's a big statement for me. *fans self* I'm getting a little emotional here.What struck me about this game is that it is a challenge. I appreciate that in order to get somewhere in this game - to accomplish anything - you must really pay attention. You won't find random epic loot in chests. You won't get neat armor from killing a bear. Bears don't wear armor. It just makes sense. I also really love that you can spend your time doing whatever it is that floats your boat. You don't HAVE to do anything to have a fulfilling game. It's a true sandbox. Right now, I'm playing on a fairly small server. There are usually 3 - 5 people playing at a time. But already, there is community. I can imagine that it will only improve once there are more players coming in. Because there are SO many skills, and so many jobs to do, trading and building alliances actually has meaning. Obviously because it is in alpha, there are some bugs and improvements to be made. I'm confident that they'll be coming in time. There are some things that seem overly difficult, although it may vary from server to server. For example, on my particular server, apples never grow back. We must plant and replant. Food is quite difficult to come by. Foraging for edible plants almost never finds anything.  A disproportionate amount of time is spent trying to find it, and hunger levels grow quite rapidly. I spend alot of time catching my breath, and waiting to be able to play again. After all that mining and lumberjacking, I would have thought my character would be fit enough to run for 20 seconds! :POverall though, I really highly recommend this game. After just a few hours, I was hooked. There is a steep learning curve, but there are many resources online that will answer your questions.I'm very optimistic about this game's future, and I will definitely be spending a very large chunk of my time playing it. Goodbye, social life! :D

number of helpful: 18 of 27 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 22, 2014
Early Access Review
								*EDIT*One of the biggest flaws with this game, shockingly, has absolutely nothing to do with the actual gameplay. Before I get started, I want to say, I am a fan of LIF:YO. I have invested 300+ hours into playing this game, and am extremely in love with the concepts brought in by the actual developers. And I have to say, no one wants this game to succeed more than me. However, as a fellow gamer, and enthusiast I feel I must bring this to the attention of the uninformed. And I do not do it to dismantle or deface. I do it because these issues MUST BE FIXED.  That being said, I'd like to get started.Life is Feudal's development team is shady.Now, it's unclear as to exactly who is calling the shots, perhaps it's known, but I personally do not know. What do I mean "Shady"? Well, let's see. There is poor communication between LIF Development team and the community. Month long silences and lack of actual updates on what the company is trying to achieve, progress and just really anything in general really define a bad public relation. Think: You've just sold 10k copies of your game, and you haven't updated us on what you're doing?I've been part of Alphas and betas before, and this is possibly the worst Alpha phase I've ever been apart of.See, when you ask for money NOW in order to develop your game. You're expected to keep your users updated. And updated on your main site for everyone to see. WE expect to know what is going on. We want to know upcoming content, we want to know what you're working on, we want to know what issues you're having, what preperations you're taking, interviews, insights SOMETHING ANYTHING.You won't see that here. You see, LIF actually USED to kept us updated, even with the smallest of details. And personally, that was important to me, it let me know that the Dev team was passionate and working hard, and fed me the information I needed to know. But after the game got Green Lit, COMPLETE RADIO SILENCE. AND THATS WHAT MAKES IT SO SHADDDDYJUST LOOK After Steam sales: http://i.imgur.com/Fq3uL2G.pngNotice THE HUGE TIME GAPSBefore Steam sales: http://i.imgur.com/oMzj5bv.pngIt feels like the Devs made the quota, and are just messing around, losing interest on development. And that's TERRIBLE. I MEAN, why else would the live streaming, and daily posts just stop? Absolutely Shady, and unfortunately, that's not the end of it. This next part of my review is so unsettling and anger inducing to me, I have no idea how I can present it to you guys. See, if you thought that Alpha without any insight or progress reporting was pretty shady, this next part is going to shock you. LIF:YO DEVELOPMENT TEAM MANIPULATES INFORMATIONWhat do I mean by that? I mean that every single element that does not favor them positivly IS REDACTED. ARE YOU SERIOUS? Is this F*** North Korea? Take a look: http://i.imgur.com/EkatQwy.pngThis is a post that was quoted by a user, that was posted in reply to what "Bobik" posted on the discussion board. The original post was deleted, as well as the actual post that Mr Bigdad posted. I was actually around at the time and saw the content of the original post. However, I cannot recite it word for word, I can tell you exactly what Bobik posted in essence. Essentially Bobik admitted to not expecting development to be getting "far". A comment that would essentially hurt the publicity of the game no doubt. When development doesn't think it's going to make it, it's sounds like a pretty screwed project to me personally. Any sense in a company would immediately do some sort of damage control right? Rather than going the safe way, explaining that things have changed and the future is looking much more brighter, extending a hand to the community. LIF Dev team would much rather DELETE EVERYTHING. DELETE THE ORIGINAL POST.DELETE COMMUNITY MEMBERS COMMENTS. DELETE DELETE. AND THENNNNNNNN~COMPLETELY F**** LIE http://i.imgur.com/sqXoNT3.pngAre you serious? It's like they have 0 respect for the community that they're expecting to pay the bills. Lying straight to our faces. They literally apply this practice with EVERYTHING. Especially users who leave negative criticism. Oh yeah, leave any sort of negative feed-back on their forums and discussion boards and guess what? ITS DELETED. SERIOUSLY?!?! http://steamcommunity.com/id/leewells2000/recommended/290080/I for one, am going to stop my support of this game, until BETTER CHARACTER IS DISPLAYED by this company. I want formal apologies to the community, and I want transparency of the development. Until then, I cannot, in good concious reccomend this game to anyone. AND THAT PAINS ME. By now I suspect alot of you have lost interest. And that's how it should be for any company who lies and cheats in order to maximize sales. Until these issues are resolved within management, STAY AWAY. Now if you guys want to know what the actual game is about, continue reading.   So what's this game about? Well, you create a character and assign it starting stats. You pick a faction out of 3 (I'm pretty sure this will determine building types later) and Name you Character. When you start, you spawn randomly in a world. (Currently one static map) and you are thrust into the role of someone who is new to the world. You'll need to find food and Shelter.    There's various skills that you can level up, by doing different things. And each skill branches off from base skills. For example, if you progress down Forestry eventually you'll get to Logging, and leveling logging will eventually get you into Carpentry. The system in which the game is laid out on, is extremely deep. The game gravitates everyone to work together, much like in actual old medieval times! The game naturally pushes you to work and play together, and not artificially either. Interactions with other players are intense and require you to decide if you want to use diplomacy, or perhaps just all out go agressive. Life is Feudal offers so much deepness that you'll quickly realize, that you're actually role playing the trade of your character. No other game has immersed me so much that I would play out the role of my character.     The game is all about building up a community of real players, who all do things that contribute to the betterment of the settlement. One of my personal favorite things about the game, is the Quality mechanic that they've introduced to us through the game. It is a genius and extremely well thought out mechanic. Every item, every building, every weapon, and every tool has to be crafted. And the only way to craft them, is by collecting the materials from the world. Every single resource, every rock, every Tree, every plant has a quality value. And those qualities help determine how well they perform when you craft something. It is a very welcoming mechanic, and adds a new level of deepness and involvement to the game. Overall, the game offers refreshing and mechanic rich gameplay that pulls you in and doesn't let go. At it's current form, it offers 40 Hours + of deep grabbing content. And while the graphics and interface are not up to par, we must remember that it is in it's Alpha Phase. And if one is being held back from experiencing this Gem of a game because of pricing, one can find solice that it is worth every penny.That being said, due to the issues in management, and the absolute S***ty public relations, I cannot reccomend this game to you. As a company as reckless and so willing to censor and lie directly to our faces comes with a stigma. This company needs to get it's s*** together and prove it can handle a single cent of yours. And sadly, it is not currently. And while the game itself may actually be addicting, it's completely USELESS if the company running it are unable to respect the gaming community.Thanks for your time.

Early Access Review
								In my opinion, very very good.....but follows the pros and cons. after that see my comments in general:PROS- Good graphics, good fps even with a reasonable not top of the edge machine like mine- Almost no bugs for me!- Free world to do whatever u want.....build, train yourself, kill etc- Not hard to learn (lots of stuff in wiki etc and easy game mechanics)- Good ppl base- Lots of skills.....learn as you go and perform....but ppl abuse the chance of getting that easily cause the company allows it (see below).- Can build tons of stuff and they do have a purpose (like protecting your stuff, getting betterweapons, doing better gear for pvp) etc- Amazing easy, crafting that has a purpose (I guess I said that)CONS- Servers created by players. For me this is bad! Specially when the devs give them the right to change a lot. The servers colapse a lot couse its too much or dont load......Alpha or not, its anoying- You can create a server with 100 multiplier on skill gain....What? Maybe de devs didint wanna have the labelof grinders in their game, but a sandbox should have some.... You shouldnt max out your forestry skill in 1 hour. I tried to create the server myself...no luck........hours on end waiting....but it might be the day or the flux of ppls. BTW I choose the default which is 1 multiplier for skill gain and thats it.....No one would join me but I dont care. Games like this shold be a process, specially in community......It takes time and effort.....

								Did originally write a negative review because it says it is single-player, and it was different to how i thought it would be.However, I have since played the game online with a community that I know and it has been great fun. This game would not work as a SP game as you can only have a certain amount of skills, it would involve making a lot of alt characters. Game has a great sense of community spirit and you build a lot faster if you all help each other out. I am having great fun with this game.Still, if you are after a single-player experience I would not recommend this. But honestly try it out for the multiplayer anyway, you wont regreat it!

content:
Posted: April 21, 2016
												A brief summary of my experience of Life is Futile.1.   Got conned into buying by one of my friends.2.   Joined the server he was on, with high expectations.3.   More friends joind in, we started to have a merry band of men :D4.   Collected wood, plants and grass (enough wood to start my own version of Ikea and enough grass to fuel the whole US cattle industry for a decade).4.   Worked as a collective to build our own vision of Utopia.5.   Some guys in Knights armour turn up and try to bully us.6.   Spent hours learning skills and crafting our own weapons and armour.7.   Find out the King has sent his trusty Knights, also find out the King is a bit of a cretin...8.   Got together with others on the server, who dislike the King and plot a treasonous rebellion.9.   Usurped the King and declared myself ruler.10. Find out the King is friends with the admin and get our whole group banned from the server.11. Repeat step 2-10If you are happy being a peasant and working for others, this game is for you. If like me, Hitler, Pol Pot, Stalin, Saddam Hussein and Barack Obama you want ultimate power, rent your own server!When the devs implement bridges, I will claim one and guard it like the Black Knight from Monty Pythons Holy Grail...Until that glorious time comes, Life Is Futile will be a bitter sweet memory.P.S. Lost count how many servers we got banned from...

number of helpful: 16 of 24 people (67%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 17, 2016
												After playing M&B Warband, for many many hours, I was starting to look around for a similair game, to kill my waiting time for "Bannerlord" (The new M&B game comming soon).This game has fully lived up to my expectations and more!Not only is the game true to the medieval era, its also slow-paced and relaxing. :)Building a simple house might take some time(hours), especially if you are alone, but when are playing with IRL friends, or just guild members, you can really start building some interessting stuff, like we made a castle wall with a trench in front of it!Very good time-killing indeed. :DIn this game you can:- Pray to God, and bless others with Gods words!- Dance around on your enemies corpse (lots of emotes)- Hunt down animals, and then get rekt by a boar. Trust me, hunting is so much fun xD- Raid other bases, but beware of the consequences! People are nice in this game, until you start messing with them!- Do honorable PVP. Most people do not attack out of nowhere, but some do, and it makes for some interessting battles.- Trade with other people and guilds! Best way to get stuff early game, is to work for others, to get some rare ressources! Ask around in Global chat, people are always looking for someone to do their dirty work. :)- Tame your own horse, train it, AND MOUNT UP! It really feels awesome riding around the lands, on your sturdy steed !- Craft your own weapons and armor, and look like a bad♥♥♥♥♥!- Dig a mine. Remember to reinforce those tunnel walls, or else.... :P- Weather & Season system! I love the season changes ingame, and the weather also seems to affect the harvest for your crops!- So much more.So, just buy it already! What are you waiting for?But remember, your Life will be Feudal if you do ! :)

number of helpful: 8 of 9 people (89%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								The Game is great! I have over 400 hours for a reason and likely to put on a lot more. Things to remember: its early access and not the finished game, you play on player owned servers currently and all have their own sets of guidlines and rules, also different rates and maximum skill leveling abilities. The game is very craft centric so expect some aspects to be a long grind.So far the game is very craft centric. You can blacksmith, build homes and castles, farm, tame animals, mine and log, if you can think up a craft in a fuedal era more then likely you can do it in game. To do this you need to collect resources or work out a deal to have others collect them for you. All of this and every aspect takes time. You will spend a lot of time building up to the point you envision your character to be. This is very grindy and definetely not for everyone. If the thought of spending a day or so moving dirt to level off an area to build your cabin makes you ill then you should move along. I never thought I would enjoy it as much as I do. I some how find the game very relaxing.I am not sure how I feel about combat. I havent done much PvP and have not leveled up those skills significantly. It however feels a little floaty to me at the moment. It however has a more urgent feel to it then other games, as death or unconsiousness bring permanent penalties, whether its just loss of property or loss of skill and attributes, you wont want to make defeat a hobby. I know seige warfare is coming if not already out and that sounds very fun.Claiming property is relatively new. It protects your land from intruders by making it so that tresspasers can be punished without any of the negative affects associated with murdering neighbours occur to the land owner. Also gives some penalties to the tresspasser. Its a nice touch.The graphics are beautiful, yet not otimized. I expect further improvement with that as it gets closer to a release. Some animations and sounds still require work, however the game still does an excellent job at being immersive and mostly natural.All in All this games is very good and definetly deserves a positive rating.

number of helpful: 9 of 11 people (82%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 17
												At the time of this writing I have spent over 2500hrs in game.  That is over 100 days of game time.  What have I to say about my first 100 days?  You will grind.  You will become the grindiest grinder ever.  If you stick with it.  If you like games that will keep you coming back to finish what you started then LiF:YO is the game for you.  If you have the attention span of a tea spoon?  Maybe not so much.Finding an active server with an active admin is a big help in LiF.  Finding a server that suits your play style is very important too.  If you want PvP, there are servers for that.  PVE?  Yep, there's servers for that too.  I play PVE because I like to build and have alot of Netflix to watch but LiF offers many opportunities for many different play styles and schedules.Overall, like any game, there are frustrating aspects.  Mostly tea spoons crapping up the landscape with fences and furnaces that can't be removed easily.  Horse drawn carts are still not a thing and terraforming will suck the soul from your breathing corpse.  There are also some real positive aspects.  Community, a sense of accomplishment, different types of game play to suit your needs, a very deep skill tree and the feeling you get when you finally figure out how to do something and get to pass that knowledge on to someone else because you've been there and done that.Oh yeah, the wiki is so out of date it still predicts Hillary will win.  Should probably work on that.

number of helpful: 26 of 43 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								Progression perfection.... Almost.  If you plan to play, I suggest a 10x skill server until the game releases, 10x will take a skill from level 1 to level 70 within 2 hours, from level 70-90 within 2 hours, 90-100 within 2 hours. 10x might feel like you are progressing too fast but the truth is that it's only unlocking things you can do. You can only progress as fast as the crop and item crafting timings take.When they say 100% sandbox, they are not joking. Currently there are a few irritating things such as tunnelling but for the most part, the sandbox aspect is pristine.Combat as of now sucks, if you're looking for pvp then this game isnt for you " At The Moment ". Once the combat is fixed, this pvp system will be the least OP system I've ever seen. If you can click a mouse you'll be pretty good but that's not all there is to it, swinging the curser back and forth will actually make your character swing accordingly.Buildings are at a wide variety as of now, but I really really hope they add more due to the fact that on 1x speed the construction skill will take days to skill up to be able to build simple buildings.... Please please please DEVs, add a WIDE variety of buildings to destroy the grind of building ovens and destroying them to waste 1000s of clay. I don't even want to mention the Wattle-Fence-GrindAnimals are endangered species as of now.Skills seem to be at a high amount but in all honesty there really arn't many trees to go through if this is to be an MMO, the only professions as of now are Blacksmith, Herbalist, Architect, Farmer, and Hunter. Might as well not even count the Hunter because if everyone goes a pure, each profession could be a master Hunter as well.Rate 7/10

content:
Posted: January 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								I will try to be brief...I do not judge based on potential and will change my rating if in two years this game is complete and warrants a better review.  (In my experience people seldom have incentive to finish a project once they all ready have been paid).The game is so boring that even when you log into a "pve" server sad bored players all run to kill you with a two handed sword...once you are killed you will respawn on a map that is so small that someone will kill you again before you even get your hotbar set up (you will be naked at this point and your skills will drop below the minimums because of the death penalty).The game is not intellectual at all, those that say that it is must be the types that don't know milk comes from a cow.  It is very intuitive and typical of survival games.  However this is the most tedious one in history...it feels like the game makers are trying way too hard to keep players from progress because there is no content. I will discuss only two of the simple tasks made horrible.  Digging...digging is so slow and boring I could LITERALLY go outside and dig a larger hole in half the time it takes inside the game...(I am talking clay soil folks).  Eating...to make it feel oooohhhh scarrry you will have to eat 40 roots in a single day to keep your health up...A human can go 3 weeks without food in real life but for some reason game makers want to make you eat like a pregnant 10k lb Hippo (hungry hungry hippos).  Oh, did I mention it will take about an hour of your real life to collect 40 roots and you will have burned up about 5 roots doing this act LOL.In Conclusion...if you have $40 burning a hole in your poket, have never played a survival game before, and don't mind someone boosing thier low self esteme by keeping you from even playing then you have found your game...otherwise wait two years and see if they even finish the project.

number of helpful: 10 of 13 people (77%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 4, 2016
												WARNING!!!! This is not a game for lazy people xDFirst of all! The bad reviews of this game are for two reasons: 1-on alpha the game had some bugs, low fps and low graphics; 2- (most of that bad reviews) - people who dont like games that you have to work on it to get something.There are two types of games: games like CSGO,Battlefield,COD,etc  (games where you start with all of your weapons and you just have to play it) and games like this one ( games where you have to work hard to have your stuff).This game is for the people who loves medieval era, roleplaying, pvp, and work like maniac! Dont get me wrong this game is amazing and with a lot of potencial, but for you to have sucess you have to have a lot of time invested in this game and playing with your friend help a lot too.So what you need to know. . . When you creat a character, you can choose what you want it to be (stats, professions, looks), when you log in to the game you dont have any tools just cloth and some food but you can get tools from the nature arround you and then starting to craft and raise up your stats and professions.Crafting system: very complete i must say, you have a lot of things that you can create but you need to have the skill to do it. Combat system: is kind of diferent that you should expect, it takes a little of pratice but for this game it works pretty fine. When you are try to do some damage every things counts, lenght of your weapon, quality and combos that you use.Pros of the game: really hardcore miedeval simulator, roleplay, community, crafting and combat system, graphics are most better then the alpha version.Cons of the game: Optimization, the devs are still working on this subject. If you want to run this game on ultra... well you can dream about it xD You need a really good graphics card for that, but in medium that what i use and i have a gtx760 i run the game at 130 fps +/- depend on the server, so its getting better.I advice you to see some youtube videos, tutorials, streams and studd, if like what you saw, buy this game, its a really good game. Is that type of game that i was looking for so many years. Tip: 1- If you can wait for some sales and buy this game always save some money;2- Buy the game before MMO is realease, because when it realese the game porbably will be more expensive and if you have bought this game before mmo realease you got one character slot for free on mmo.

content:
Posted: September 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								  I got in the game, didn't know how to move.  Imagine that I hit Escape and see that pressing Tab turns off my cursor. DUH! Now I can move.  Now what? Well pressing keys randomly, theres TONS.  A skill tree, a backpack, a paperdoll for my equipment.  A stat List, all lockable and raisable/lowerable.  You need to start at the left and work your way right to do stuff in the skill tree.  Before long I chop down trees, stack them in piles.  I dig a copper and an iron mine, build a forge.  Then a Kiln.  Before long I have a Blacksmithy and Anvil.  WHOO Metal weapons and armour!  Woman seen me play, ohh noes! Now she's farming! Growing crops / tending the stables.  And Sir Noc is Born, riding his warhorse, armour and weapons.  Who dares trespass in MY village I worked so hard for.  Heres some apples pesant, now beat it!

number of helpful: 10 of 13 people (77%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 11
												The MMO version is updated often, but beta tests are far and few between unfortunately.  There are certain features that are only sensible, such as horse drawn carriages, but there always seems to be underlying coding to be taken care of before adding new features.  LIF:Your Own is hardly ever updated, and receives little to no attention.  With that being said, I am sure once the MMO is in its final Beta stages, many features may be moved over to :YO seeing as the MMO is more of a testing platform than :YO is.  With that said, this is one of my favorite games I've ever played.  It comes with a heaping helping of GRIND, and feudal life at it's best.  The crafting is lengthy and difficult, and combat is very reliant on practice.  Because it takes so much time and effort for the littlest of things to be accomplished...  It feels just like that.  An accomplishment.  Few games nowadays make you feel rewarded for putting in effort whatwith the silly achievement systems and the buy-to-win and free handouts methods of games to keep players playing.  To really work for gaining anything has its own reward when you get it.  Reminds me of questing in Everquest.  Difficult and very lengthy, but damnit, you earned that Ghoulbane!Would recommend.Waiting for MMO to complete.

number of helpful: 10 of 13 people (77%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 20, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game needs a warning. It is mostly grind. You will grind to get resources, you will grind to move resources and you will grind to build. Pretty much most of your time will be grinding. If you don't play this game with other people, then you probably will be burnt out. I would say that if you enjoy Minecraft and working with other people, then you'll most likely enjoy this game as well. The sense of accomplishment from building a castle or large keep is pretty great. If you say, "I did this." Then people will realize how awesome you are, because of the many months you put in to build that castle or keep.What I don't like about the game?Takes forever to build end game buildings.Everything has a timer. Digging has a timer, mining has a timer, gathering resources has a timer. You can pretty much calculate how long you will spend to gather resource or calculate how long someone else spent building.If you are just starting out, gaining levels is mostly grind. Joining someone else's establishment and using their tools and equipment allows you to level up fairly quickly compared to that initial player.There is no automated way of moving resources and trader carts for moving resources is slow.Loading times and lag. For some servers, I can take a shower and come back and just be entering the world.Game can feel like a second or third job as you are cleaning the barns, stables and coops.What I like about the game?I like to dig. I dug in Minecraft. I dig in Life is Feudal: Your Own. I'd probably dig in the MMO if I was going to play it.There is something about the game mechanics when playing with other people that give a better sense of community. You are sweating and crying together and that gives a bit of comradery. Griefers can't currently destroy your buildings. They have to work at doing anything too destructive, for the most part.The role play is what you make of it. There are some pretty good role players.
