content:
Posted: November 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								Great game with lots of promise. It takes a while to build things and level up which is great for longevity. My only problem with this game is the MMO aspect. Everyone on here bangs on about how great it will be when there are thousands of players running around. Umm ... great ... so all my hard work will be undone in the style of Rust. Can't wait. I've heard there will be more things to do if you want to play solo, but I'll see how and if that pans out. I can't not recommend this game - it doesn't have dragons or spells which is refreshing. Don't get me wrong I play solo which is still great as I love all things medieval. Only issue is they've made a fantastic game but without singleplayer, which seems to be the norm these days. I'm sure it's great with a team of you but not everyone wants that. I just wish there were more games like this but in singleplayer. But this is the best so buy it and go solo - and hope more NPCish aspects get added. The rendering on the buildings look wonderful and the cities people have built look amazing. I'd quite happily spend days or weeks or months building it all on my own - just wish there were a few (just a few) NPCs to say "hello" to. At least there are animals to kill I guess.

content:
Posted: October 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								Bugginess/state of the game:I've spend a few hours on the game. And it's occasionally buggy and not well optimised. But hey, they're not hiding the fact it's not finished. It's playable, that's the most important thing.If you can't handle a crash once in awhile, don't buy it.I haven't had much issues, but some friends have had it worse than me.Gameplay:I personally love it. But if you're an impatient man, do not buy this game. Doing things takes time.In most survival games you have a full fledged base in maybe a week or even less.Here 1 weeks worth is having a small house and furnace (if you play alone) or a village with wooden palisades (if playing in group).Now this game is not meant to be played solo. Many server have the recommended level cap. This effectively limits you when you play alone, as you can't have all stats maxed. You can do everything decently, but not perfectly.There are server where the cap's been increased, so you could technically be a one man powerhouse.But more often than not, expect there to be roles. Towns tend to have a dedicated blacksmith, carpenter, tanner, etc...This game takes time, especially being a bloody herbalist..... there's just so many freaking herbs.If you don't have patience, don't buy it.If you like a community and working in group building up a medieval society, go ahead. Expect to shovel a lot of dirt leveling out land though.Watch out for bandits aswell. People still love free goodies.

Early Access Review
								Having played 1,017.9 hours of this Alpha game i am still not disappointed . even with all the hickups and problems i have experienced along the way. I am pleased. Support has been quick, regular patches - implementations of game material and fixes.it should be noted for new players there is 1 modification to a steam file that will significantly improve your game experiences.  . In my experiences Since purchase i have played across many servers . Raided , constructed , terraformed, farmed, hunted alongside many players who have had alot, if not the same playability concerns . though once you work a few bugs out. this game is awesome in its open ended gameplay. Which encourages players to work together. Ive found most of the ♥♥♥♥♥ing and whining to come from players with high expectations who are expecting a polished out of the box RTR version, or players who are generally not up to a hard grind type game to achieve anything and just want to troll around killing and not working towards anything. Of the playability problems this game has a few, and most of those problems vary from player to player .  most can be sorted with a little bit of fiddling with settings and such. What else can you expect of an alpha.. well worth the $40 i spent. but be prepared to put in some hours to enjoy this game to its full potential.. you wont be running around decked out to the max overnight . or even in a week for that matter . you need to play the game for what it is to enjoy.   ive since started a server of my own and we are setting up community's and infastructure etc . planned events on a scale we havent been able to achieve before .. currently the only server that isnt dead from what i gather from feedback from players. goodluck i hope you purchase and would like to see you in game . if you are from australia .. all the best

content:
Posted: November 23, 2015
												Overall: great game!It will keep you entertained for hours. If you are a right player type for this game you may spend even hundreds or thousands of hours.Yes it is a niche game - really hardcore one, meant for elite groups of dedicated players.Some will not like it for been to in-depth and too grindy at a times, but this is what it takes to feel the significance of your achievement. You invest time and feel yourself proud when something is finished. This make you don’t want to lose what you achieved, because usually it will take far more than a day to restore. This together with so called “alignment system” makes players behave themselves in-game and in general  community is far better than in other sandboxes.Some say there are bugs and visual glitches... well they were, but devs are quite fast - 2 patches in a first 2 days after release and they were fixed, at least for me. Performancewise not that bad actually. Taking that I’m playing on rather old gtx 680 on PC and not so fast 850m on laptop - avarage of 30 FPS on medium to high settings make me feel comfortable.And the last but not least - this is not for a singleplayer mode. It is possible to start a server for yourself and tune its settings to play with decent comfort, but it is absolutely no fun at all. The point of this game is communication between people, friends or foes does not matter it will be fun in both ways!So I highly recommend this game. Get some friends and start your feudal life!

number of helpful: 43 of 76 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game holds a lot of promise, and it looks like it's going to be a lot of fun. It's richly detailed, and the graphics (for a game of this Minecraft-esque premise) are very good. To say it's even in "alpha" stages, however, strikes me as a gross exaggeration--even in spite of the "early access" label. Basically, all you can do is perform the same limited set of functions over and over, and write bug reports--something that used to earn minimum wage, plus all the coffee you could ever want. Before you shell out $40 for this game, bear in mind that "playing" it constitutes what used to be called a "job" at this point in time. It's very, *very* incomplete, riddled with bugs in every function, undersupported by its help functionality, and exceptionally confusing. In my personal opinion, while--again--it shows every sign of becoming a great game in the future, it's not very entertaining at all as-is, and doesn't merit a price tag at the present time: the developers, if they can't pay someone to play it or handle the playtesting themselves, should be farming it out to family and friends for assistance, or trying to crowdsource additional development/playtesting funds, or doing *something* other than saying "Hey, this is worth $39.99 right now."

content:
Posted: September 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								If you are a fan of Wurm Online or perhaps have played Wurm Online and wished there were gameplay improvements that will very likely never come, this is a game to look into. Life is Feudal: Your Own is a title which is temporary, a proving ground if you will for the MMO component which is coming supposedly in October. At 3x3 KM squared it is not a large game world right now however the developers have stated a significantly larger world will exist for the MMO in October. There are of course glitches and bugs as well as UI issues just as in Wurm Online as the games bare many similarities but in my opinion the game is already in a better state than Wurm Online is to this day and contains far less of the major issues that I have with Wurm Online. I can recommend this game to anyone who has played Wurm Online or enjoys games in that vein. It certainly does NOT deserve the negative reviews it has and if anything it simply has a learning curve that seems to turn some people away.

												Don't let the mixed reviews deter you from trying this game. I admit, it isn't for everyone, but if you enjoy more slow paced, realistic, sandbox type games, this hits that sweet spot. Yes, it takes a lot of time to accomplish things, and yes you will need at least one or two other people to play with in order progress very far, but what results is a far more relaxed and social approach to the online survival/crafting sandbox genre.This game doesn't hold your hand and can be very difficult to learn how accomplish anything at all, but once you do figure it out, everything feels like a massive accomplishment, which is rare in games these days. As a result, the time you spend in game feels far more rewarding than other games of this type and is well worth the investment to learn it properly.As I said before, it isn't for everyone, hence the mixed reviews, but if anything I mentioned above sounds appealing, then it is certainly worth a try.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2015
												"You know you addicted to a game when your computer is toaster and you have to play it with minimum settings just to run it with 26 fps"This one of those games where your fun is decided by server and its players. If you are in active server with active gm-s and events/rules you are going to have fun time. Game itself has only basic elements (combat, crafting, building), server administrator/moderator or guild has to decide how the gameplay should be. For example: Players build trading area and make rule, that this area is no combat zone (written rule). There is no function in game to make it safe area, but gm-s can enforce that rule with kicks and bans.The skilltree got it own pros and cons. I like how you first have to too level up skill A to get access to skill B and you cant level up everything cause skill point amount is limited and because of that you need to coop with other people to get mats from skills that you dont have. What I dont like is that if you want to level up archery you have to have leather armor, to get that you need to have farming, to do farming you have have construction, to do construction you have to have mining and so on. Ofc you can skip all that if you find someone who can craft leather armor and is willing to trade you.When it comes to trading, game got no currency. So trading is done items-for-items and because there is no currency you never know what is valuable for others. You can ask in global chat, but lot of server got rule - No trading in global. In my opinion having currency would boost quality of gameplay a lot.Building houses and other stuff is something that everyone prolly like to do. Building is very time consuming escpecialy when you are alone. Building basic constructions that you might need like furnace or anvil can be easily done alone, but building fortress or complex housing needs time and having right skills.I recommend not because "it got potential" or what it going to be in futured. I recommend it cause I had more than 50 hours of fun and if you are into building, co-op and roleplay you are going to have more than 50h of joy. Also the development keeps moving on. I have heard that they are trying to turn this into MMO, with bigger map. So I ques they use this game as test out functions that they are going to have in MMO version.When it comes to bugs, I did not encounter any gamebreaking for me, but I also have not tryed all out like sieges and large scale battles. Biggest bug or glitch I had was wolf falling trough mining sealing and attacked me. Surely this aint game for everyone.

number of helpful: 9 of 12 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 20, 2016
												This game is a medieval life simulator, not so much a true "survival" game. It does indeed have survival elements but the focal point of the game is PVP and a very in depth and lucrative crafting system. While you may wonder why the game has some mixed reviews, it's mostly because it is a very hardcore game that fits with only certain personalities. Also a lot of the negative reviews were from a while ago when the game was riddled with bugs and people were upset. That's changed a lot and is now a mostly polished experience.Solo play can make the game difficult, and jumping into the world with no friends or unable to find people can make you feel extremely overwhelmed. Most servers have a very awesome RP community with it and if you find one with good rule sets you have ample opportunity to grow your character into something special. Having a group though even if just a few people is a MUST. I cannot stress enough solo play is highly discouraged. You want to focus on a certain few professions to specialize in as you can be a "jack of all trades" but to get the maximum reward you want to specialize. PVE content is sparse besides game animals there isn't anything else other than starvation that can be PVE, so if you're looking for ONLY PVE this IS NOT the game for you. Understand that PVP drives the game, but crafting is really the most important and time consuming aspect.As I said before it's more of a simulation, giving you the ability to immerse yourself in that middle age time period and reap in rewards. Crafting is top notch and is extremely gratifying just doing something as simple as terraforming to plant some trees or dig a tunnel system to mine some ore.It isn't for everyone, it is a game that requires patience, time for your effort to reward you but once you get into the world you will be hooked. I've loved every minute and the RP I've had is just so fantastic. Once this game turns into the MMO it will be even better.The game is not without bugs, however none are game breaking, the inventory system isn't very friendly and the UI can take some getting used to but there are tutorials and a very good wiki to assist you throughout. While the price tag on this game is a bit high, you can justify it by the fact you will get a game that isn't like all the other survival games out there that end up being a waste of money and get abandoned. Combat is physics based and if you've played Chivalry it's very similar to that so it should be familiar.. I rate LiF:YO a solid 7.5/10. If you love crafting, survival, RP, PVP and medieval times this is a must have to your steam library.

content:
Posted: April 15, 2016
												Life is Feudal is not for everyone.  If you are completely unwilling to play with open world PvP (despite probably one of the best anti-grief systems around,) want quick action on a constant basis, want to gank people without any resulting issues, find the idea of needing other people to do much troublesome, or just don't like a slower pace where building and crafting your community is big goal... then you likely won't enjoy this game.  *Note:  you can play it by yourself and use GM commands, so if you just want to craft away slowly and enjoy the island in the :YO version... then much of this doesn't apply!*First, the game is very crafting heavy.  In the Your Own version this can be worked around with GMs.  However, that all depends upon server rules for multiplayer.  In the MMO, crafting will likely be a large part of your content.  Crafting requires other professions, and has a little more complexity than your standard MMO fare.  It isn't something that will leave you guessing, though, like many other systems do.Second, the game has systems for wounds, decaying gear, building decay, etc.  All these things need to be taken care of, along with food and possibly thirst.  Additionally, your character can become exhausted and need to rest.  You will have concerns other than just what to hit next.Third, the game uses a physics based combat system.  You must aim and time with ranged attacks.  You must aim and time with melee attacks.  If the damaging part of your weapon does not make impact you won't see much for results.  This will be something some like, and others do not like.Fourth, the game is not finalized in many ways.  It is released for this version, but more work and improvements are still being done (just the focus is now on the MMO.)Fifth, the game uses a time basis for a number of things (trees and plants, growing herbs in the garden, raising your alignment *which relates to the anti-griefing system,* etc.)  Darkness is dark (unless you gamma adjust... which I wish was not the case but oh well.)  Dealing with good time management will get you more than working without it (although you can get around that in this version.)The Developers are consistently on their forums, and interact with the community.  They take a lot of the feedback we provide and work on making the game better.  I highly recommend anyone with an interest in the game to look at some of how the game plays, to ask questions of the community and developers (they are on various social media as well as here,) and to consider what you want out of gameplay.  If you are looking for a long term game with social ties, building a community, and dealing with the various other aspects as talked about this may be a game you really enjoy.  If not, you may wish to pass.  The game is not for everyone, but for those who would enjoy such things I do heartily recommend it.

content:
Posted: October 2, 2015
												In my opinon, this game has so much potiental to be a very successful game. It is one of the best survival games out their on the market. There is so much that I want to talk about the good and bad about LIF but this is a review so I'm going to try to keep it short. Even though it may be the best but their is still room for improvments to satisfy us gamers. "cough cough, morning lag"There are some flaws but I cannot think of any ATM unless you consider "morning lag" to be one of those flaws.The crafting is amazing and there is a diverse range of players (with good or bad ethical gameplay). The game design of the enviornment is beautiful and UI is customizable. I enjoy the option to do some role playing with other players in the game, it just makes the game so much more enjoyable.  Overall, I recommend people to try out LIF (life is feudal) if you enjoy similar survival games like "Rust".YEARS LATER...LIF has improved and excelled so much with new redesign, gameplay sound tracks, new items that help players to survive and features. There is so much that I cannot list all without boring you.Sadly, there is still morning lag. I also like to mention that there is thing what I call "HORSE LAG" because the lag is horrofic when your ride either by just yourself in a medium to fast pace. It is even worse when riding your horse as a group of horse back riders.Those haters of the game just don't appreiciate what this game has to offer. For those who find the huge learning curve of the skills is a hassle. Then you know what, there are other games out there that come with a huge learning curve too. If you haters like to play easy games, then go play minesweeper and call it a day. These haters are not gamers, they are CASUAL gamers.  For new players wanting to try this game. I highly recommend it if you are into medival styled RPG and MMO. Plus you new players will pay a smaller price tag than I did when the game was still in early access.

content:
Posted: November 27, 2015
												I had this game for ages in my wishlist never quite found the urge to buy and play it. Now after it got released me and my girlfriend finally found the time to play it. And oh boy we just could not put it down. Even though it walks the line between tedious and rewarding with mixed success it has a certain appeal and ambition when it comes to it’s huge amount of crafting that has to be praised.It is to minecraft what the arma3 is to call of duty. Everything requires time and planning. Everything is a bit more complicated but the smaller things are that much more rewarding. And did I mention time? From your primitive tool up to your crazy fortress requires a constant combining of skills and crafting to the point where undertaking huge projects must be tackled in a group. Unless you are truly insane and your rent is payed for 10 years in advanced.On a sidenote make sure to join / create a server that has the right settings for you and or your group. Nothing worse than building a wall only to see it go up in flames a few days later because object decay was on or to high. You also might not want to grind your teeth every time you try to level up your skills. Server settings could make or break this game dependant on what kind of playstyle you prefer. Happy building!

number of helpful: 21 of 35 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 12, 2016
												I have played the game substantially more and really wish that I could change this review to recommend, because I think the game developer's intent is in the right place, just executed horridly. It really gets a “meh” more than a no. This is why: (all of the bullets tie into each other at the end)SKILL SYSTEM:  Skill system is built around you not playing as a lone wolf. While it is possible, the skill tree does not exactly allow you to accomplish this task without an unreal amount of game time and multiple characters. 2 or 3 would be needed in order to craft all of the different items. Not saying this is a bad thing, just something the solo gamers need to be aware of.MAP SIZE:  Sadly, the map "appears" to be larger than it really is. I have walked the island several times now, just to take in all of the different terrain features and how everything is laid out. The map suddenly gets smaller once you do this. Truly.UI ISSUES/LEARNING CURVE/EMPTINESS:  Steep learning curve due to a fairly poorly implemented UI and overall game mechanics, in my opinion. I joined a good group of people and really got taught the ropes and while I started to understand the game a great deal more and was more successful. The emptiness and game quality around me persisted. The animals run like Ultima Online servers during live world events over 20 years ago. Not kidding you.BORING WORLD:  Wolves, boars, bears, deer, moose, and every other creature in the land is stiff. Everything is like a still portrait of animals who do not move unless you step on their tail. Even when being shot 20 times with arrows, "peaceful" animals walk 5 feet and stand still. Why do I need to shoot a boar 20 times to kill it? Heck if I know... tough boars in this game, I tell you what. Took 15 arrows to the face and nothing. Every animal of this game is offspring of Chuck Norris.NOT SO MUCH LIKE LIFE:  Master Hunter? Don't worry, you still can’t tell the difference between a hare, deer, moose, or sow. Maybe my character’s intelligence was too low to tell the difference. LOL. Stupid mechanics.SERVER POPULATION DISPARITY. Server sizing is one issue that really gets me annoyed. None of the servers are DEV run. The servers that are up, either have 0-20 players or are full during most peak and sometimes off peaks times. 64 players is simply too small to make this game enjoyable, especially if your friends are on a popular server. Which means you need to make the map bigger…which leads me to my next point.SHANTY ISLAND OR NO MAN’S LAND:  The servers have a tendency to be filled with players every hundred meters or so sporting a shanty hut, or you are left to rot on an island by yourself.FAIL ADMINS: You are at the mercy of the server admins. Some server admins think it is ok to kick you, so their buddies can get in. Or if you didn’t upper case your character’s name. Didn’t happen to me but one of the people in my group. I am looking at you RPCLiF… fail. What is to stop them from kicking you when you beat them in a fair fight? Nothing really.TIME SINK:  Total and complete time sink to an unacceptable level. While I do love to play games that allow you to mold your character and really build a city from the ground up, I don't want to do this in game with real time. If the skill increase is default, quit your job or fall behind. You will get your butt kicked by the unemployed and retired.BOTTOM LINE:  The game is really fun if you have a lot of time on your hands with a good number of friends. Join a lower population server or better yet, create a private one and try to have some fun with it. Joining the wrong public server could leave you and your friends with nothing to show for a great deal of hours’ worth of work. Middle of the road to a little bit below. Avoid buying it unless it is on sale… like 80% off or more.- - - - - Initial Post- - - - -My initial impressions of this game, regardless of all the thumbs down I may (will) get: Total and Complete Boredom.Once you get the hang of your first few crafting tools and make a few different characters, while you jump from server to server trying to find other players. You begin to see how dull the game really is. Community involvement is deplorable. The servers who say “new players welcome” are seemingly the worst and have very little to actually offer new players.The world is empty. Seriously…looking for group? I started my adventures running through the woods and see a deer, but little did I know that was going to be the only deer I would see for the next 2 hours. As I already stated above, the player base is so tremendously small, you spend your time running from walled up keep to another walled up keep. The only player interaction that takes place in global/server chat is poo-talking back and forth. If they speak at all.A game without NPC’s is a great idea, except for one really big problem here: You made the map size tremendously big with a 64 player limit. Hell, I’d like to see 64 players in just ONE of the keeps I passed. In its current state, the game needs NPCs in order to prevent the thought that I am playing by myself in a building sim…with very limited creatures. I started to feel like Gilligan, but even he had company.Tutorial is outdated. How can the tutorial be outdated already? It is in freaking development! If you are going to make a tutorial, at least make sure the UI you are using is the same as the videos played for new players. Largely because all it does is confuse the living freak out of the player base more. Oh but “it’s early access!” - get over yourself. The excuse is 5 years old now and does not excuse every problem a game has. Some stuff is just lazy.

content:
Posted: September 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								OH GOD WHAT AM I DOING !!!Is what a lot of people are shouting right now and that's fine, it's a brand new game that only a minority of gamers will know how to play from the get go. But have no fear because once you get the basics of the game it really starts to open up, the best thing to do if you want to get in to LiF is to go here and give this page a look over https://lifeisfeudal.com/billing/tutorials.php doing so will get you to the point where you can "play" the game instead of running about like a headless chicken. You done that ? no ? yes ?....... ok good moving on.So LiF is not an easy game, if what you were looking for is a game where you jump in and are a Badass from the start then no sorry this isn't for you, if you want a Single Player experience with AI and a story then no sorry this isn't for you, If you want a community centered game then YES this game is for you, there are no Shops, no Guards, no Doctors/Healers, not even a building in sight, this is not Skyrim or Mount and blade, if you want any of that then the players have to Be/make that. And it takes time for that to happen, i've played this game for 7 hours straight and all i got done was chop some trees down, catch some fish, make the ground flat, mined for iron and found nothing and smacked a wolf with a shovel. But during all that time not once did i think "oh this is crap, this is boring, i'm going on another game." you know why ? because it's all new, it was fun not having a clue what i was doing and i still don't. One thing i will say though is try and band together, don't just wander out in to the wild and try to make a house because you'll be at it for days and i mean IRL days.

Posted: February 17, 2016
												Luckily I bought this game on sale so I only threw out like $20Let me make this short and sweet as I can for readers convienance. This game is a hellah grind, both level wise and mental wise meaning if you want that big awesome looking keep then you better be prepared to scoure the land for every little piece of wood, stone, thatch, and oddly shaped animal skin nessicary to build it (Thank almighty God for infinity piles) The developers are being sketchy as ♥♥♥♥ about more then a few things and without a good group of people to play with you might as well not even try. The combat system in this game is a joke, It is literally faster and easier to kill people just running around bare♥♥♥♥♥naked with zweihanders, you cant see arrows in flight both from archer or victims perspective. Dont even bother building wooden walls and lastly you wont do much else from beating a stick against a rock without investing some SERIOUS time into your server. It seems almost everyone is out for you just for the hell of it and there is really no proper usage of horses yet and player animations are SUPER exploited.Do I think this is a bad game? Certainly not....oddly kinda fun and satisfyingCould it possibly be more than a time sink one day? AbsolutelyDoes it need a nerf and rework in many areas? Oh hellah yesAll I am trying to say is that it might be a good game one day and is fun in the short-term but until the developers actually buckle down on it and start having more and better updates and add some MAJOR patches to this thing and desperately needed content this wont be much more than just another regret. Simply put, dont bother logging hours in this game until it gets alot further along in development and actually gets polished out alot more to the point where it is playable beyond something of a trolls breeding ground.Guess it is true what they all say, Life is Feudal

content:
Posted: March 20, 2015
												At this point in development, the enjoyment you get out of this game is pretty strongly correlated to the quality of the group (guild) you play with and the server. This game is really one where you HAVE to work together, especially on servers where the settings are close to what the MMO will be (600-1000 skillcap, 0.5-2 multiplier). However, now that the guild claim system is implemented it can be very rewarding because everything within your guild monument's claim is protected.   As other people have said, it is a pretty slow paced game, which makes it realistic, but I find a lot of newbies don't seem to grasp that. You have to put in a lot of time and have patience in order to get a settlement going and get armor and weapons. And even then, if you're playing on a pvp server, you still need to put work and time in your settlement to improve your defenses or another guild is going to surpass you technologically and wipe you out.  If you're doing multiplayer (where most of the fun is to be had), I would highly recommend using teamspeak, mumble or the like for your group. Communication is essential in multi.  All in all, I've definitely got my money's worth out of this game. This style of game and the way the devs have implemented most things so far seems perfect. I can't wait for the MMO. EDIT: Jan 2016, since I've written this review (March 2015) this game has gotten so much better. Almost everything is implemented, graphics are improved, dx11 optimization kicked in, and with horses and siege weapons it just seems so much more complete. Definitly buy this game and join a settlement. In-game or out of game. Guilds are always looking for players who are smart and willing to contribute because it is a two-way street. Everyone benefits from having more crafters/gatherers/buildiers/warriors/specialists to help them and to help out.

content:
Posted: October 17, 2016
												Good, solid game. Interesting, in-depth gameplay. Few bugs, efficient game.9.5/10After close to 100 hours, I revisite this review and must say that lot of different things are constantly drawing me back to this game. I found it well built, like, moreso than usual early access MMORPGs / Survival. Maybe for a good reason because it's been in development for 4 years, mainly through crowdfunding. Also, they're indie. Indie forever :D :DI think their engine scales well for various PC capacities, and it has a very distinct feel and style to it. The gameplay is smooth, although rather slow in its execution, and that's exactly what I was looking for. It is a early medieval/dark ages, realistic, skill-based, open pvp and combat. I like the deep, complex crafting and ressouce gathering and management. The game is very complete in terms of what activities/skills can be used, from building, farming, landscaping, hunting, taming, riding, fighting, resource gathering, resource transformation, tanning, dyeing, etc. The more you use a skill, the more skill points you gain in that skill, but it is capped, and the characters can be modified and continue to evolve in different ways to fit your playstyle pretty much forever.The game is also evolving towards a full-fledged MMO (its currently 64 players max per server) on a gigantic map, which is currently in closed Alpha. It will eventually open to all owners of the game. So there's very active development and huge future.

content:
Posted: November 18, 2015
												I haven't put as many hours as others have put in. I was drawn in by my husband who has put in more hours than I can count, and wanted to include me in on the fun. At first I was skeptical, but as I played it I found I really enjoyed it. I enjoy the challenge that the game gives, as you travel and struggle to find the best resources available to build your village/town/kingdom, and when you complete it, that sense of achievement that you built something awesome.Now with every new release and update there's going to be glitches. It happens, but the build team has been attentive to the issues and do work at fixing what's wrong. That being said, I look forward to seeing the progress of the game as I continue to play. The glitches are minor on my end, so it's definitely not an End All for me, cause I know it takes time to smooth things out. I definitely recommend this game for gamers who enjoy this kind of Genre.

number of helpful: 5 of 5 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 23, 2015
												This games environment and ambience in general is very beautiful. I obtained this game just recently and i have to say that the game came a long way since it was first released. Everything is designed to give the person playing a "life like" experience. You literally feel as if youre in the game yourself as there is so much to do, hunt, build, and etc. Making or joining a community can be great and very interesting for the most part , as this game is completely community based as your gameplay goes on. For these reasons and a perhaps a few others, i say that this is a really great game to check out.There is a negative side to things though, but in this review im going to focus on the character creation. The game does not really follow the aspects of its own title...well the "YOUR OWN" part. I believe the idea of the game was to in a sense, self insert yourself into the game; put yourself in the open world to fend and make the most of yourself. But i see that really difficult when there's only 3 races you can possibly pick in the game. Knowing the intention for their game, why did they decide to give the player no variety on races? It beats me. But i think this is something that should be thought of in the near future.Everyone who plays this game will not be white or asian (hence the 3 races are basically White, white, and asian). So from my perspective and probably others, the lack of variety makes it somewhat hard to have that "self insert" vibe when playing. I see it as a major factor  that if took into consideration (as in adding races that resemble the african american, spanish, or indian race and so on) this will enhance a persons enjoyment and experience in the game when they can make a character  that represents themselves and possibly their culture in RP.Other than that, as i said, i would highly consider to try this game, because overall, you will not be dissappointed. Just know there's A LOT TO LEARN. But it will all be understood in due time.Thanks for reading ! :) <3

content:
Posted: December 24, 2015
												This game has real potential, so long as the developers keep actively working on it. It says release, but it's more of a beta, as planned features are yet to come and some in-game features are still a bit buggy. It's also yet to be optimized and suffers from crashes and memory leaks. Definitely not a game for everyone, as the learning curve is steep without joining an established guild and the chances of surviving alone are slim. Also has a lengthy skill leveling system that will make some impatient players unhappy.Before you buy, I highly recommend looking this up on YouTube and getting an idea of what you're getting into. It's an excellent game if one can overlook the current issues - which the devs are actively working on. But, with all its cons, the medieval life you will lead in LiF:YO is extremely satisying, especially when you build your first house or complete the walls around your lands.

number of helpful: 39 of 70 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								Summary: While this game is pretending to be everything it fails to become anything in the foreseeable future.Yes, the game has absolutely no future except being an early access title until its distant demise. Yes, it will be early access for very long time. Take a couple of years.It is ridiculous how with such large gameplay scope developers fail to design even basic features and mechanics. It's not even interesting to study the design of the game as it is usual with other early access games.There are several very obvious evidences that the game is designed very poorly. What is bad about design flaws? Design flaw is much worse than even a hudred bugs. You just can't fix it without destroying some part of the game. And one design decision is always connected to the others. Redesign is a chain reaction that involves most part of the game to be reconsidered and recoded.As it is usual happens with independent developers they pay very little attention to a game design. They jump to start coding and modelling. Well it's good if you're designing another simple puzzle or arcade game - they tend to have very short development cycles. On the other hand - games with such gameplay scope as LiF have very long development cycle - about a year. It means time needed to code a tech demo after design revision.This development cycle we have now is already wasted. Next development cycle will be wasted too. Not just because developers are bad or something. But because the game system will be so complex that there will be unexpected results.To prove my point, here's some design flaws.1. Terraforming.Terraforming system is purely artificial and is a subject to heavy changes in the future. Right now terraforming consists of too artificially combined systems: landscape terraforming and tunneling. It is very easy to see that tunneling artificially blocks landscape terraforming in its vicinity. That's just because developers have no idea how these two systems should interact.Terraforming lies in the basis of the game so any changes to that system will result in a redesign of the whole game.There are so many questions that needs to be addressed here. Will there be a cave-ins? Can you build a house inside a mine? Maybe a farm? Do I need light inside? What if I will dig upward to the surface?2. Skills.Right now there are too many skills in the game with very little logic behind them.Let's say you want to be a hunter. Track animals and kill them to get hides and meat. Not so fast. It seems you have to learn how to plow ground first and grow crops. And only then you will be able to dry a deer's hide. That logic.Same problem with terraforming, prospecting and mining skills.There is no obvious way to choose some simple role. Skills are divided and interconnected in some weird and unexpected way. Obviously skill system will be revised very soon. It's just awful.3. Skill cap.Well, I bet developers are very proud they have "invented" a such an original way to milk LiF MMO players for money. Of course you will have to buy character slots. Why else this skill cap is even implemented? You won't be able to create anything in the game without 3-4 different characters involved. That's the only reason.The worst of design flaws are those which was made to make us spend money. Because you can't fix them and they ruin the game the most.4. Hunger.It is the best example of a system that haven't even been thought about. It's a typical placeholder. And yet it's the most important system. It is one of the reasons to make players settle in some place. Some place where they have created a food production chain. If you won't be able to make them settle - they will be roaming around freely to kill and destroy. Because it's the natural pastime of human beings.Right now you don't have to hunt, fish or grow crops. You only need to make weapons and armor to kill someone.Well, I'll just name few more problematic mechanics which have to be designed yet.5. Quality migration.6. Private property.7. Claiming lands.8. Criminal acts.9. Water travel.10. Howling-transporting goods.11. Deconstruction.12. Siege.13. Off-line characters.14. Tracking down criminals.15. Trading.... and much much more.It's sad to say that developers doesn't even bothered to study some references. Like Haven & Hearth, for example. It's obvious they have played it. Yet they haven't analyzed it's design decisions and flaws. And they already trying to invent something "new". While they only will end up reinventing the weel.Edit: Fixed mistake about skinning a deer. It was about drying hides, not skinning.

content:

Early Access Review
								Very deep crafting. Has a good economy of players required to build a cities/towns. Combat could use some love (which the developers have confirmed is one of their first orders of business). The graphics look pretty damn good and performance is good as well (Lower detail on trees or else it'll be a slide show). With sped up skill-gains, it allows players to experiment and try every profession relatively quickly. Anything from tracking animals and setting traps to keeping the fire of a forge high tempature for smelting. Two of my favorite mechanics: When you hit track animal, actual footprints show up in the grass and you can follow them to find your prey. When you search for herbs, herbs will appear in the vegetation around you and you must spot and gather them manually.

content:
Posted: November 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								So, Life Is Feudal – what a spectacular game concept and with the level of developer commitment that has been displayed thus far, I am excited to see what the finished product will look like.  Let's just get the summary out of the way so you don't have to read a wall of text if you don't wish to do so.  I will detail everything later.The Summary:LIF:YO is a stand alone game that is being developed completely separate from another project the devs are working on (MMO).  The price tag is a bit rich for an Early Access game, in my honest opinion, but that $40 was well worth it simply due to the fact that have on record almost as many hours as many of my “fully polished” titles in my library.  There is plenty to do but at the same time, it is very possible to hit a brick wall until other features are added or tweaked.  Overall, if you like a game that simply takes time and effort to create something very cool and organic, this game is for you.The Deets:You start off with nothing more than the rags on your back.  It is up to you to find a suitable area to sustain and survive.  Is the game possible to play single player?  Absolutely with some tweaking of settings or multiple characters.  Is the game more fun to play multi-player?  By far!  Either set up your own server or join one to play with more people and make the game really exciting.  Build up your defenses, barter with your “neighbors,” master a skill set that no one else in the area has mastered to make yourself a more valuable asset to the community.  All of these things take time and effort to accomplish, but the reward is that you have built something to truly take pride in.  Fixing a broken down wall isn't as simple as replacing a couple blocks.  It takes mining materials and the skills of multiple trades to raise the wall again.Resources are diverse enough to offer quite a bit of exploration and travel to various locations.  Are they a bit too sparse?  Maybe.  But for what the game is now, it feels appropriate.  Use the materials you have to refine your skills and make higher quality items for trade or protection.  The possibilities are numerous!There are quite a few bugs... there's no denying that, but the devs seem to be on top of things as long as they reported accordingly.  There are some balance issues within the game that make it falter.  Again, the devs will surely address these before the game is finalized (hopefully by Q3 of next year as they plan).  The UI and combat can definitely feel clunky and unresolved, but over time, it will get more and more optimized to better suit the needs of the game.Essentially, what you have to remember is that this is an Early Access game and there are going to be bugs.  But if you can past those bugs, horrible optimization, crashes, etc. and realize that the game offers far more positive ideals and possibilities, you enjoy the crap out of it.

												I really can't recommend this game. After a whole day of grinding, I barely even built anything. The crafting system is unintuitive and the tutorial is very poorly designed. You have to equip tools to be able to craft stuff even if you're sitting with said item in your inventory. Everything takes forever to make, so long that I wonder if this wasn't meant to be played with 20 friends! It's really grindy with absolutely no reward at the end of the day. Even though it's been out for quite some time, it seems unpolished. There are visual glitches in the animations, no help system included and the battle system feels like it belongs in the 1990's. Think of this as a cheaper 3D version of Runescape, with no monsters, no animals, and no one to play with.

content:
Posted: September 4, 2015
Early Access Review
								                                                                     INTRODUCTIONThis game is a great game. With its early access. Its still fun. Sure there is no tutorial for how to craft stuff. But the fun is going online and finding out how. You dont want to know how to do everything in one way how. You could be know the craftings of only a Blacksmith or how to build or make food and not know anything else. Thats the main fun. The other fun thing is how the guilds work. They arent like a regular MMO medival guild. Its Realistic. Come home from work, hop on the game. Say hi to your buddies and tell the new people where you from. I met a guy today from Kentucky. He helped me skin a bear. And then, after that you do your job. And do the same. The other people who play for 9 hours guard or are the Owners of the faction. The System is great, and the people are very very nice. Greatest community I have ever met. Another thing that happened today, it took 3 guys with Scale armour to kill a beartwo went unconious the other fired like 16 arrows into the bear. They said it was dangerous for me because I had Leather.And so I went out, I found a bear and they warned me, I got knocked down sure and retreated to the water. I then slinged it and retreated. Slinged it and retreated. About 50 Slings and it ran away but I slinged it about 4 more times. It sat down and it got tired. Finally it died after 8 more slings. I got the Black guy to come, Everybody was amazed at what I had done and I felt like this was the best game I had played this year. I am waiting for more to come                                                                                    REALISMThis game is trying to be realistic also. With the way the AI act to how long crafting and growing trees are. I would love it if there would be guids with huge factions with Neighborhoods with about 6 people in each house and a Kingdom with about 50 people. Men and Woman (Woman that are Girls irl would be alot realistic then Fake woman) filled in the houses. It would also be great if there was random AI bandits. the AI bandits for the Wolves and Bears are great! Sneaking upon there prey. I stalked upon a Wolf and followed it upon Miles until it turned around and tried to eat me. It ran after it saw my buddies chase upon it. That was also a great feeling! It acts like real AI! Bandits or enemy humans would be a great addon with own tents and also expanding and also coming from the Ocean sailing with ships.                                                                             ONLINE: PLAYERS AND THE COMMUNITYThe players are friendly and feel like your talking to real friends irl. They are helpful and its unlike the true internet that insults with or on your Iphone with all kinds of Drama. I only have seen a admin have to ban a player for Sexually assaulting sombody and then trying to kill him. But I then heard he was a new player as his friend joined. The new players can also be very nice. This may be my first day but this is my experince. Diffrent then any other game I played. Sometimes the Younger players that are 12-15 would do somthing like hit you but as long as you know them well and you die close to a house that you spawn at. Best is not to scream at them unless your teamates do. A man named Jacob kept killing us in our own guild. But it was fun, we all hid in a barn and Jettman the owner moved and he found us all... But we were all having fun because we all worked hard on our skills and getting Resources so what else do we do? Going raiding is fun sure but I mean real fun.                                                                                  GRAPHICSThe Graphics are good. Includeing the Sun going down looked realistic not just going down instantly. It took time. I played on all Settings High and the game didnt lag or give me a bad Framerate either. Only a couple lag spikes. But I would give the Graphics a 9/10. I heard alot of people say the Graphics are good.                                                                            OVERALLI think this game is well done and not rushed. I never wrote this big of a review besides Arma 3. But this review means more then any other of my Reviews. I think the Dev's did a great job on this. They even reply to complaints. A review complaint was a guy that was banned because he said the game was boring in Early alpha. He later was unbanned because of his Review which changed. Other Developers dont do this. Other games ignore peoples bad reviews and ban them thinking it solves it until they ban half of there game. Everybody is nice. Give this game a try. Watch broacasts also to help.

content:
Posted: September 28, 2015
Early Access Review
								Yah, I played it a bit. It was OK, I guess...In all seriousness though, I've been taking a break due to school and what-not for about five months, but I used to play the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of it, hence the 1500 hours. It's an incredible game. I remember the first month it was out, the sense of exploration, real people trading with others, people owning bustling shops, real landlords with real slaves and farmers, real crafting specialists, it's all player-driven, no NPC's.It just got better and better, exploring new things, no developed Wiki to guide you through, and after a year it evolved into what it is now. They have built upon an epic, moldable foundation and the game has so much content to work with.Yes, it can get incredibly repetitive, but that is if you deny the way it is supposed to be played, and that is with others. In feudal times, you would have to rely on other to assist you in survival, it's not supposed to cater towards people who want to bolster all skills and survive on their own. A house needs glass, for that you need a smithing craftsman, It needs lumber, so that needs a carpenter. And then finally, you need an architect to design the house. You cannot adorn all these skills alone, so it forces you to rely on others which is something really cool.Bustling player-built cities, large-scale battles on open fields, struggles for resources and power influence, the things that happen in this game are endless.Right now, they are 64-slot servers... imagine everything I said above on a 10000 slot server, which is what is planned for the near future... AWESOME!

content:
Posted: November 30, 2015
												The devs are active, and the current problems it has are the sort that money will fix. It is worth £15 not £25, in its current state, so get it during a sale.The player community is lovely, and in a way the game's mechanics encourage cooperative behaviour through roleplay and establishment of organisations such as 'kingdoms'. Individual players have the opportunity to make their own choices in a (sometimes) violent world, so there is a balance between gaining followers through public image and power.The 'Mixed' rating is because the game was put up for alpha in a state where most players experienced game-breaking bugs, this is no longer the case. The game is now about ready for release. It could take players directly from minecraft. Once the game switches to being an MMO they will be re-submitting it to the store, so the rating will be reset without the hindrances and I'm expecting positive reviews.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2015
												Honestly, this isn't a survival game. This isn't like Rust, or DayZ, or anything else in the entire category of survival games. This is a unique Multiplayer Sandbox RPG, with a very satisfying atmosphere, a ridiculously deep crafting system, a deep skills and levels system, and at times a painstaking amount of realism. It's challenging, it's rewarding, and it's addictive. I bought it this last weekend, and then shortly after bought it for five others. We're all hooked.When you see a decent sized group all toiling away at their various jobs, it feels like the world is alive, which so many other games have failed to do. Honestly, ♥♥♥♥ing fanstastic.Oh and the weeaboos 10/10 would kill myself again did these kids learn to type by smashing their club hands into their ♥♥♥♥ing keyboards?

number of helpful: 53 of 97 people (55%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								Tried this game when it first came to steam. This is a rather my experience than a Review.So. You came here to build a house? Okay lets start by learning the TERRAFORMING skill. Thats needed in order to become a CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS PREPERATOR.... (whatever the hell that is). When achieved a sufficient level (60 in most cases), by digging up ground for HOURS,  you begin preparing  construction materials, needed for your later home. Again, you do this FOREVER, till you achieved rank 60 in that skill. When you made it that for it allows you to learn the construction skill.... With lvl 30 in that you made it. after 8 hours of boring skill lvling, you think you achieved a point of mastery where you can finaly build a home, no, HOMES for many! But no. Lvl 30 in construction allows you to build WOODEN objects only. Well... okay. Lets start cutting down some trees you say? NO. FIRST LEARN FORRESTING (planting trees, examining trees, and getting branches from them), WHICH IS NEEDED FOR LOGGING. So, note that youve spent about 10 hours of gameplay just for achieving the necessary skills to build a house on that 1 particular server. Okay finally you can start cutting down those stupid trees you examined 50 times each. Well, some of them. THe hard wood trees are to tough for you with your logging lvl 30. After you cut down your first tree and wondered "Eh what the heck do I do with that log now." You realize that you have to learn ANOTHER SKILL, to make something out of logs. Yea Logging lvled to 60, CARPENTRY ACQUIRED. you start sawing those 1000 logs into the most beautiful boards mankind has ever seen and look at all the work youve done.... Preparing to FINALLY start building your home sweet home. You begin building your little wood shed... but whats this... nails needed?! FFFFFFFUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUU-Okay you already learned Terraforming so, no big deal. Lets beginn with learning PROSPECTING. TO LVL 60, to be able to prospect for iron. After that you learn MINING, again to lvl 60, to be able to get the precious Iron ore you lust for and to be able to SMELT the Iron.... YOU NEED TO SMELT TONS OF IT, but only skill smelting to lvl 31 this time, because the next skill you have to learn, Smithing can be kept at lvl 1. Thats a present from the game designers to you, nails can be forged with a Smithing skill of lvl 1. 15 hours later, just after finishing a shaggy wood hut, the server crashes, disappears forever.GG, 0/10Try/buy the game when it became a MMO.

number of helpful: 8 of 11 people (73%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								"Un juego prometedor".Life is Feudal: Your Own, es una versión previa a lo que será un MMO muy ambicioso. Por lo que he podido probar hasta ahora, os puedo decir, que el juego aunqu está verde, es funcioanl y puede uno hacerse una idea de lo que será el juego final cuando lo acaben.No compres este juego si piensas jugar sólo:Life is feudal, se puede considerar como un verdadero simulador de vida Feudal. Empiezas sin nada y tienes que crear todo de cero, pero no experes una experiencia acelerada como ocurre en otros juegos. Si bien hay servidores en los que la progresión está acelerada y puedes aumentar tus estadisticas y habilidades rapidamente, la versión final del juego pretende ser un simulador de la vida Feudal y bajo mi punto de vista bastante realista. Tendrás que crear herramientas primitivas que te permita recolectoar recursos para hacer otras herramientas más complejas y así poder obtener recuersos a su vez más complejos. Deberás crear tus estaciones de crafteo y hacerlo todo desde cero. Crear un horno, moldear la arcilla para hacer un molde donde más tarde verter los metales fundidos que te permitiran crear un yunque por ejemplo. Si piensas hacer todo esto tu sólo, posiblemente estés muerto antes de que puedas hacerte una choza donde estar a salvo. Es un juego de grupo, gestionar los recursos, esconder tus tesoros, hacer guardias. Nuestro personajes tiene un limite de capacidad. Lo que no puedas llevas encima, tendrás que esconderlo. Posiblemente debas hacer guardias con tus compañeros de juego para mantener vuestros progresos a buen recaudo. Necesitarás todo el espacio libre en vuestra mochila para poder hacer las labores y trabajos que tendrás que desempeñar si quieres que tu grupo progrese y se haga fuerte dominando estas medievales tierras. Debereis trabajar muy duro, debereis organizaros, hay muchas cosas que hacer. Hay que procurar comida para el grupo, recursos para avanzar y dar protección a todos los que estan trabajando en vuestro asentamiento.La politica será fundamental. Vuestra supervivencia se basará posiblemente, no sólo en el numero de hombres que seais, si no también en saber ser diplomáticos. Hacer alianzas cuando es necesario o dejar claro al resto quien manda en el territorios que estás trabajando.Todos querrán hacer su aldea y progresar, tener una fortaleza, un castillo y hacerse grande. Pero habrá muchos que no puedan conseguirlo y se dediquen a saquear al resto. Life is feudar es un mundo libre, no hay roles predefinidos. Se lo que quieras ser. Puedes crear tu imperio. Puedes vivir robandole a los ricos y repartirlo entre los tuyos. Quizas prefieras ser un mercenario y prestar tus servicios a un guild a cambio de un suculento botin, o simplemente explotar los recursos del mundo y proveer a otros reinos. O por el contrario, quizas quieras hacer de intermediario. Comprar los excedentes a unos y venderselos a los otros. Puedes ser un señor de la guerra y dedicarte a fabricar armas con las que comerciar con los reinos en guerra.... Las posibilidades son infinitas, porque las reglas las pone la comunidad. Y este puede ser el peligro y punto debil del juego. Es un juego que depende de una comunidad activa de jugadores y ahí estará el exito o no del juego. Lo cierto es que es un juego no apto para todos los publicos. Es un juego hardcore, no apto para cryer. Deseamos mucha suerte a los desarrolladores y esperamos que sean capaces de sacar el juego de forma sólida y sin dar oportunidad a los hackers para joder este juego.Yo por mi parte, lo he comprado para dar el apoyo al proyecto. Como juego a día de hoy es entretenido si juegas con varios amigos y una gran oportunidad para ir aprendiendo la dinamica del juego que es bastante más compleja y extensa de lo que a priori parece.En resumen, un autentico Sandbox simulador puro y duro de lo que sería vivir y progresar en un mundo medieval.Disfrutadlo.IMPORTANTE: No lo compreis si esperais encontrar un juego terminado y sin bugs. Muchas de los arboles de habilidades y progresiones aún no están implantados. Está todo en fase de desarrollo y aunque es jugable, no hay servidores estables y son reseteables. Tu personajes y su progreso así como los cambios que hagas en el juego están sujetos a que el server sea reseteado (y con ello la perdida de todo el progreso en ese server), cosa que ocurrirá más a menudo de lo que os gustaría.

number of helpful: 9 of 13 people (69%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 19, 2016
												So my friends and I bought this game apon its release on Steam back in 2014? My impression of this game since then has changed, immensely. It went from a really rough game to play, performance wise to.. a really beautiful game to enjoy.. performance, graphic, and gameplay wise over this time since I initially bought it and up until now.The updates are weekly, and the Devs seem to be focused on the main goals. - Though with updates comes small errors sometimes, but they are quickly addressed.I come from giving countless hours to the games like, RoK, ARK, Rust... and various other games of the sort, and in these games you can go at them solo, eventually you might succeed in time.Unless you intend of being just a guy that makes the finest weapons in this game, even then you will need a partner to play with... so let me stop right there.This game isn't like most games. Read the title, you see that word "Feudal"? It means a whole lotThis game will eventually make you rely on one another. It will make you want to become friends with that a##hole of a neighbor, because he has the goods you need.. and you might have the goods he needs.(Then eventually you blast his doors down with the supplies he traded you, then you need him no more.. heheheheh!!! ^.^) This game is a great game, it has molded into a great game. I hear stories of this "MMO" that is soon to be released, and I look forward to it.In all honesty though, I'll likely still be playing this because I have yet to experience the full "Monty" of the game on LIF:Yo.You can pillage, plunder, mine to the center of the earth and then drown yourself in the endless sea below.You can beat your friends up, and get rewarded skill points for doing it.You can be marked a criminal after constantly spying on your neighbor on his land, then go get blessed by the Holy Priest of Tamriel, go back kill your neighbor, and God still hears your prayers!I can't even write to you all the things you can do in this game, your best bet is to just take my word for it.. It beats RoK anyday, but as in time consumption.. lol it definitly beats it.So after this time of playing on the newly updated LIF:Yo I decided to rent a server and host some of the best events a Medeval era could have.If you'd like to buy this game and try it out, feel free to look up this server.. it'll treat ya right!Two Kings Kingdoms

content:
Posted: September 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								  (Skip to bottom for review)  STORY  I found out about this game a week before it came out, and my excitement was crazy! I cringed at the price, but knew that i was not only getting this game, but getting a slot in the MMO RPG version as well: which made me feel less nervous about  the price. Finally it downloaded, and i jumped right in with a few friends.  It was hard in the beginning because we had absolutely no idea how to play. But we got along nicely. We found a very nice European server where we joined up with the locals in making a town. I was incredibly surprised to find that i had no lag though my ping was 200. Once we got the rhythem of things, we began to enjoy it alot more.   We set up a little village in a valley where it would be easy to make a living. Farms surrounded our village, mines were started on the outskirts, and the village flourished...kinda. I will point out that it is very hard to start a village, let alone maintain it. But we did!   At this moment our village still sits in that little valley, where we live in peace and hope to one day become a flourishing city...REVIEW  This game is a very ambitious one: the amount of things you can do is outstanding!  Everything from mining and crafting to cooking and farming: this game offers a spot for every person's interest.   There are bugs of course, but they are being resolved quickly, The developers have proven to me that they are dedicated, and show that through the patches that are put into the game, however small they may be.  The bugs i've noticed are more server side and game crashes than actual in-game bugs. In all honesty, the game as Early Access is coming along quite nicely.   However good the game may be, people still get turned off by the price.  So my advice to people thinking about buying the game is this: If you are interested in the game, by all means get it. But be warned that you may have some troubles along the way. But in the end you get two games out of it: Life is Feudal: Your Own edition, and the MMO RPG version when it comes out. My advice to the developers is this: Please tone down the price. 40 dollars is not something you would expect from something labelled as Early Access, however far a long the development of the game may be. I understand that you are trying to fund the MMO RPG, but more people will buy it if the price is around 20 dollars. You will still make the same profit you are now because more people will buy it.

Early Access Review
								The Alpha of this game has been great, for the players and the company. I've played a lot of alpha's, beta's, and pre-orders. This is already become my idea of a great game. As with most gamers, in the back of our minds we all have a "dream game that one day I'll make." And at least for me as a strategy, simulation, and Sandbox Multiplayer type guy, this is great, and as close as anyone has come.It's very much like the game Civilization, except you are the Settlers and Worker units you sent out to start a city. You build improvements as the Worker unit in and around your city. You clear trees. You farm the land. You build city improvements (Shops, Kitchen, Warehouse, Walls, Market (Trading Post).You build Roads, often between cities, especially those within your kingdom.And combines that with a FPS, even though the models and actual combat are rather lackluster. Well, except for the armor models, the Heavy and Royal versions of all of them are pretty sweet. But eh, it's there. It will be improved.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2016
												First off, this game is not for everyone. It's almost like a job at times and will be grindy. Unless you have a group of friends to play with or find a group to play with in game (many groups are willing to take others in) you will be hard pressed to progress much further than a lonely hut in the forest. That being said, the number one resource in this game is dedicated manpower in the form of a player. Ive just got the game a couple weeks ago and have not been able to put it down.On actually why I recommend this game.It's hard work. I might be a glutton for punishment but I throughly enjoy games where I have to work hard for a reward or an accomplishment. To me, it makes the game that much more fulfilling. Hammering in that last log for that large 3 story house that your group has been working on for days as an example. Secondly, this game satisfies my adrenaline fix. The pvp and combat is visceral and calculated. Knowing that everything you have on you is on the line, your horse, your equipment, your armor. And yet, it is the same thing for the human on the other end of the keyboard.Current state:This version of the game is the standalone game, individual hosted servers with up to 64 players. Many of which have their own differing rule sets in regards to playstyle, raid times, skill gain, skill cap etc. An mmo version is currently in the works that has entered a beta phase open to purchasers of this game and or the mmo.

number of helpful: 63 of 117 people (54%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 22, 2014
Early Access Review
								STOP!  Please STOP... BEFORE you buy this game!!Please READ this CAREFULLY.... BEFORE you spend your hard earned money on this game!!I remember watching the video before this game launched on early access, and thinking it looked EPIC AS HELL.So then, the game came out, and almost every review was positive and full of great praise, and the game was a new #1 TOP SELLER on Steam!  WOW!So I  worked hard to earn some money.  I sold a bunch of toys and my old bike at my folks yard sale that weekend.  I HAD to have this game!!And then Sunday evening, I finally convinced my father to buy it for me, even though I was still about $10 short.And as I played the game, my heart full of super expectations began to break slowly but surely.  See, I had been worried before the game launched that the game might not be complete enough or be a bug-infested mess.  That's not the problem at all actually.  In fact, the game feels solid, way more complete then so many other early access survival games of it's sort....So, why was I disappointed?Well, watching the video ads for the game, and reading all the great reviews set me up to be disappointed.  This is NOT a survival game anything like Rust or DAYZ but just better because you can do more stuff and farm and make cooler houses.  I mean, I'm sure you can.  IF you have a group of friends all playing together and all agreeing not to pull your hair out in the insanely steep skill curve of the game.To give you an idea, I spend three hours in the game.  I traversed a large path through the map, looking for anything or anybody on an existing server with players.  I found not a single animal to run from, attack, fight or even just watch run off.  I saw no other players either.  But I did start trying to harvest and learn the crafting system some.  And OMG.  Let's just be honest and agree that in a game like Rust, most players don't have the patience to harvest wood, ore, and other materials themselves, and instead just try to kill other players to collect their loot.  Okay, now that we understand that, imagine a resource collecting game that is about 1/100th of the speed of collecting reosurces in Rust.  Actually 1/100th might be too fast, it might be closer to 1/500th of the speed of collecting resoruces in Rust.  I mean everything just goes soooooo slow here.  It takes 20 seconds to snap a single branch off of a tree.  Then you need to spend 20 seconds to collect some plant fiber from a plant.  Then find some rock terrain and spend another 20 seconds searching for flint.  Now you can craft maybe a primitive shovel.  Another 20 seconds, and bam!  So you're thinking cool!  That's not so bad, right?  Uhhh yeah, but now this shovel and your skill at using are crappy as hell.  So even if you set your terraforming skill to max at the character creation screen, terraforming even a small square of land is going to take HOURS.  And then you repeat the process to make an primitive axe, and you start hacking some of the smaller trees down.  More time, for every single little log.  And you move slow as hell to move that log where you want it.  And seeing as how it looks to take about 1,000 logs to even make the most basic of houses, you're talking about a time sink of hours and hours and hours and hours just to make anything even half way decent.  Compare this to a game like Rust where you can find a single woodpile, harvest it in 20 seconds, and make a complete shelter three minutes into the game.  or collect a few woodpiles and you can make a nice 4x4 2 story house in 20 or 30 minutes tops.  And remember that in Rust, 90% of the players are too lazy to even do that, and instead just look for other players to killl and rob.So sure, this game might be great when you get to the point of the videos on the store page, but after playing this game for a few hours, that it obviously so far away that it's honestly just not worth it.  I'm not going to spend 10,000 hours of grinding away in the game to get there.  And yes, I could get friends to buy the game and help me, and yay, then all of us only need to spend $40 each on the game, and spend only 2,500 hours of game time skilling up and getting to that point.  Ugh.  I hope you see my point.Before you even think about responding yelling at how bad my review is, instead go to youtube and watch some random game play videos.  And in all of them, you'll see people doing the exact same thing I did in my first few hours.  Collecting twigs, and plant fiber and looking desperately for fun, but saying something about needing to find friends and learn more about the game.  What I mean is, people are going to be boring crap.  You're not gonna see people with awesome houses and cities and advanced armor and weapons and epic fights.  No, you'll see this same super grind of skills, collecting the most basics of resources and the videos will honestly be pretty boring to watch. Now, if all of the videos now for this game are boring to watch, imagine being in their shoes playing the game and advancing at such a super crawl in the game.  Oh boy!The game is pretty solid, the graphics look plenty nice.  But honestly, I see about 98% of players being wayyyyyy too bored to continue to invest the time required to 'get to the good stuff' in this game.  I am a patient gamer, but playing this game made me want to break my arm to go play with the hackers in Rust instead.Buy it if you know what you are getting people.  This is not Rust.  The game might be deeper and better yes, but realize that you are going to be the most patient of all patient people to even get anywhere.  I mean in the upper like 1% of gamers.  For over 90% of gamers, even thouigh they might like the 'idea' of this game at first, they will soon find something with a much quicker speed of game play and advencement.  Not many people will want to spend 30 hours just searching for flint and twigs and plant fiber and then realize that OMG now they need to spend 90 more hours at the next most basic stage of character skill development.Most people complain of GRIND in mmorpg games.Magnify that grind by about 1,000 and you have 'Life is Feudal'.You've been warned.  Buy at your own risk now.  (I wish I had seen a review like mine here BEFORE I bought it)
