number of helpful: 27 of 48 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 8, 2014
Early Access Review
								You find yourself alone on a beach, wearing nothing but your trousers and carrying a handful of cookies for survival. As you run towards the nearby forest you see four men in leather rush up a nearby road with crossbows in hand. You decide against your better judgment to follow them up a mountain. You watch from behind a tree as they stealthily get into position below a larger force of heavily armed people. The scene before you begins to unravel; There is a vast mountain fortress with high walls and an impenetrable gate. The defenders are raining arrows and bolts down on top of the besiegers who have chopped down the trees and used them to erect palisade walls for cover. The group you followed is allied with the defenders, and just as they are about to open fire the attackers spot them. Swords are drawn and chaos ensues. Two attackers and three defenders are ultimately slaughtered, one taking a crossbow bolt to the back of the head, and the rest falling to melee combat. As the leather archers retreat to their own stronghold, the battle ends as the injured and exhausted attackers make their way back to their Viking kingdom to count their spoils and nurse their wounds. A protracted, two hour long siege on a mountain fortress, all taking place within your first in-game day. You run to some corpses and find gear, running off into the woods to begin your own adventure, and avoid the bloodthirsty feuds of warring nations. This is Life, and it is Feudal. The above is an example of something which happened on the server I play on, and I am sure on many others as well. The game itself is something many people have been waiting for - a true role playing game where you take on the task of a builder, farmer, carpenter, blacksmith, miner, forester, healer, alchemist, and so on. Players must work together to survive, establishing settlements and hunting wildlife, mining deep tunnels and clear cutting entire forests. Everything you build, or grow, or cook, must be made from things gathered elsewhere, bringing a sense of true accomplishment to completed tasks, doing away with the instant gratification many games provide for us these days. Will you be a bandit? A Thane of a Viking keep? A humble farmer serving under a just and noble lord, or a wandering merchant selling his possibly ill-gotten goods to the highest bidder? The choice is yours in Life is Feudal, and for an early access Alpha game, it is arguably one of the best games to date in my opinion. Aside from the random crashing, and a few mechanics in game that one would expect to be completely possible but are not implemented yet, I would strongly recommend this game to anyone and everyone who loves medieval times and role playing games.10/10 !

number of helpful: 27 of 48 people (56%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 4, 2015
Early Access Review
								Life is Feudal is the best medieval sandbox game ever.You can build your own little hut, a big house, a giant castle, it all depends on what is your motivation level and how many friends you got.You literally start with nothing, you got to find everything on your own from trees, rock soil, grass and animals. There is a hunger system that is not too exigent, if you eat good food you'll be statisfied for a while.You can craft TONS of different types of armor/tools/weapons, deblocking the skills to craft and use them with practice and work.The learning curve is steep, you'll have to spend a few hours to understand how to do relatively complex things. Harvesting/collecting materials can be a little bit grindy at some points, especially when you want to build a huge house or big castle walls but it's a guaranteed fun time.As of now, the game is not finished, it's in early access so there's a lot more that the devs are planning to add but still, it got a lot of content for an "unfinished" game.You can be an archer, a knight, a crossbowmen, a bandit or claim yourself as the king of the land, it all depends on your ambitions and your skills. Depending on the server you choose, you might not be able to specialize in every crafting abilities so, if you got some friends you can always talk with them when you start and choose a "job" you would like to do in your clan, may it be blacksmith, tailorer, herbalist, farmer or many more, so your group can be polivalent and craft goods without having to risk trading with other factions.As of now, while i'm writing this, this game is on sale. My best advice would be to buy it on the go, before it releases into an MMO game with big servers, it's cheaper now but no one knows what the price will be when they finish developing it.With all that said, I hope to see you in-game and...Life IS Feudal!

I struggle to find a good alternative in this genre and time period it is set in. I recommend...but be prepared to grind...That is a big part of the game. :)

								great fun if you have amazing patience and great teamwork. it takes forever to get things and level skills but that makes what you do that much more satisfing and valuable to your mates. teamwork is a must, this is not a single player game it is massivly cooperative and if you try to lone wolf it you can get nothing done. most skills require tools or items that you can only get from having other skills meaning you HAVE to have other people doing different work to support the group. currently this game is in alpha/beta/unfinished whatev but it will crash and dissconect frequently but if your the person who rage quits because the game crashes every so often this game isnt for you anyway. many promised features havent been added yet and im sure the mass bug reports from the sudden popularity have postponed them even further, though the features planned and already being worked on are amazing. that said since this game is in alpha and has those problems IF YOU WOULDNT DONATE THE $40 JUST TO SUPPORT DEVELOPMENT DONT BUY THIS, WAIT till the mmo and then you will be blown away. the devs need time and a cash injection and everyone blowing up the servers might hamper their efforts and i soooooo want to see this game reach its full potential.

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								First, i want to thank the people i met inside the game for having a nice weekend playing it. This people tried not to blame the dev's for the still early und unfinished state of a game that has a skitload of potential.The current state of the game after 4 years of development showed that choosing the right engine "before" creating a game is crucial for success. Torque3D is not. The development team should take care and finish the "base" of the game to allow a proper gameplay and maybe think about leaving this engine and make use of another more advanced plus involving the community in building it. Take ARK for one of the better examples.The game map and assets look like its an multiplayer roleplay game from the late 90's. It would not be a problem if it would not destroy the gameplay itself when you get bug-stuck with your horse on flat surfaces and can run and jump down mountains like the game plays on the moon. Random placed trees floating in the air, pretty bad controls - even Dark Souls with mouse is more playable. Some of many little and bigger things i've seen during the weekend.Community:I heard of people joining the game..and leaving again after a couple of hours, never coming back. I also heard about forum stories were devs/moderators delete comments about the current state of the game. At this state and all of the rumors, i am not sure this game was worth 20 Euros. Can i expect ongoing development or beating a dead horse for money? I really don't know, but i hope they will understand what the community has on their heart - taking care of this game that could make a lot of fun in the future.My tip:- involve community- change engine- let the community help building the game, from my experience building a strong community can help devs alot.I rate this game up, BUT its a 51/49 decision.If you expect stable gameplay or proper graphics on an Early Access game thats 4 years in development, don't buy it.

Early Access Review
								so far the game is really good. but in order to get the most out of the game, you must be patient. it takes awhile to get to know the controls, how the skills work, and you must understand why you can or cannot do certain things inside of the game. take for example smelting. you must get your mining up in order to smelt your ore. you must also be able to cut billets. that also takes skill and you must have a saw. so if you are a gamer just looking to get through everything in a day, you should not play the game because you will probably give the game a bad review and we dont want this. and you must also keep in mind that this is just an early access game. do not worry about not being able to change your gender and custimizing. that will come later on. right now they just need money so that they can add and fix things that you gamers are complaining about. i also suggest using youtube to learn more about how do to play. but so far 5 out of 5 stars. great game!

								This would be so good.If only- They'd stop turning it into some kind of soggy biscuit snotfest for village people. People would populate servers- They made the game so solo players could play it without maxing options just to get anything done- Stop introducing game breaking bugs every friggin' patch- Fixed flux to be not such a grind- Fixed the map so we don't see the ocean below my feet- Put in more animals. number of helpful: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								I am rewriting my review. I was sceptical about this game at first due to it being released to make money for their MMO, but this game is amazing. It so far hasn't had the issues of Rust and Dayz.  There isnt killing on sight due to most things you find on people are useless to you.  The skills you gain make the things usefull and things you need lots of like logs and such are too heavy to steal.  You MUST play this with others. Skill caps exist forcing people into professions with a few extra skills. Combat has a separate cap so you can be a farmer warrior without issue.  Finding other people isn't too hard and they could always use another alchemist due to their ingenious system with herbs.  Combat it difficult due to the extremely in depth combat system when you try to kill folks with stone sickles. You can get away every time against stone age tool combat. This is the most filled out early access game I have seen and is worth the 40$.

I personally am glad i made the purchase and I intend on play for as long as possible.GIVE IT A TRY.

content:
Posted: June 14, 2016
												First off this game is $40, after saying that i was not sure about making the purchase, but i took the chance anyway.Having said that this game is worth every penny.Pros: OPEN SANBOX COMEPLETLY, do everything , do nothing its up to you, wander around aimlessly if you want waste your money its freedom.AMAZING CRAFTING SYSTEM,Its not easy you will either have to build numerous buildings or play with friends because your going to need help. more items to craft than you can craft in 150 hrs of gameplay.Real life situations,  search  grow kill for food,you will have to terraform the land in order to build,raise animals,fight bears,This game has the most real feel of any survival game i have played,Cons: You cant really play on your own, you can but it will take you hundreds of hours to make this or that for this or that.This really is a game of cooperation, 1 person a carpenter 1 person a blacksmith and so on you can do them all but by the time you do your monitor would have burned out... seriously..This is a game best played by a group of friends, you run or rent your own server keep it private for like 20 to 30 ppl, you will all choose your jobs and be a part of the community, every piece being and overall part of the puzzle. build the town up to a city and everyone building thier own houses as well which you can build to furnish and actuall go inside to live, build 3 chairs around a fire next to a still and 3 ppl can get drunk with you in your house...you can atuclly furnish and go into every room.ill give this game a 9 out of 10 and well worth the money. as far as steams games go lately in a sea of early access crap this game shines through....  Im planning on running a dedicated server on my dual quad core and either take friends from current community or start a new one meeting new folks....OH 1 more thing, Before buying make sure your machine can run this... 40$ is  alot of money to waste if your going to get 5 fps....

number of helpful: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 11, 2016
												This  game? This game is special. This isn't your typical mmo where you have  to use your rotate your skills or spam to until a Mob dies, nor you can  grind for hours on end, just to achieve max level. You don't have to  worry about end game, you don't have to worry about a gear treadmill.  All you need to do is interact with other players and make the world as lively as possible.After seeing runescape turn into a wow clone in terms of combat, At first, I enjoyed it. Then I start to realize how boring the combat is. All I was  doing is going from one skill to another, just to maximize my dps. At that point, my mmo heart has turned hollow. Looking for a new mmo to fill that void. I tried countless other mmo that has the same uniqueness to runescape pre eoc. I can't. It's all the same. Every single one of them. The boring quest grinding, that even runecape didn't have that problem, The daunting gear treadmill. I just couldn't do it. Gw 2 was  pretty decent and it held me up for a while with it's more simpler combat system. The same with Eso. (Seriously, Voice acting during questing is a god send.) But this game? It has sparked my love for mmos in general  and embraced it wholeheartedly.When I first start, I didn't know what to do, or where to go. I was kinda lost honestly. So I wandered aimlessly, not knowing what to do, or how this game worked. It was so different from any other mmos out there.  Yet, I kept going, learning new things such as making tools such as an  axe to get me started. Then I met some people building a fort. They  helped me level the skills needed to build a fort and that was where the  fun really begins. Whenever I'm with people, I always have this feeling that I was a part of something. Even if they're strangers, I think of  them of my own. And when I help them with stuff like getting wood, I felt like I was contributing something big. And  that's what I realized how socially active this game made me. Don't get me wrong, I'm a very shy person, but it is rare for a game to make me come out of my shell like that. I want to continue being social, I want to hang out with other people in this game. And I can do that, because the game devs gave me the freedom to do so.I  can be whoever I want. I can be a merc who help fight a war. I can be a wanderer, going from town to town. Heck, even some sort of adventuer doing something crazy. The choice is all mine, and I love it for that.Am  I saying this is going to be this "WOW KILLER?" No, but it doesn't have to be. I might not played this game for over 100 hours (I don't want to be burned out. :( ) but I can tell you that if you buy this game, for whatever reason. I promise you, this trip will be like no other.  (Warning to all solo players. This game is designed to interact with other players. You can solo the game, obviously. But you'll get more enjoymeant out of playing with others.)

												This game...It's like The Elder Scrolls had a baby with Minecraft.Totally worth buying.Tons of crafting to do.Tons of hours to be sunk into a digital life.Don't expect to have armor your first week. This game takes a while to level up your skills. 40+ hours in and i still can't level up my bow and arrow skills, and I've been dumping major time into the game on a daily basis.Some existing bugs, but none that are game breaking.I haven't spent much time on a public server, so I can't tell you if there is a ton of KoS in this. With the limited time i DID spend in the public, people mostly were minding thier own business.The game comes with Steam tools to run your own server on your PC! But we went the pay route and have a server, since the free server is only on if that person is playing/ leaves the PC runningOverall: 8/10Loads of fun when you have a few friends to build with

number of helpful: 21 of 37 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 16, 2014
Early Access Review
								Hello everyone, my nickname is Atlantis and in most cases I keep that name aswell,I had my own concerns when I heard the first time of this game. "Another Survival Game?" I thought, but the medieval theme catched me, so I bought it a few days later trying to figure out if I could trust the developer.As a new player I was a little bit confused what to do, there is currently no tutorial or any help at all from the game itself. The current UI is working but aswell as confusing as some informations show up when you hit the right key on your keyboard, for example your skills (L), your character page (P) or simply your inventory (I). But luckily, the developer have added some helpfull entries on gamepedia.After my first steps and configurations I decided to jump straight into the multiplayer. Why? Because this game clearly is about teamplay! If you have read it by now or not, some server aswell as the planned MMO will have certain settings that will cause you to play with others to gain better weapons, a house or simply better tools. I will not go further into this as I am not writing a tutorial here ;)Currently the server performance is quiet good, although some of my mates I play with reporteed multiple crashes since the latest patch, don't forget this is an ALPHA (some like to forget such things). I enjoy the moments of gathering materials to build a building, a wall or just weapons or armor. And you will have to gather a lot! This game is extremly slow if you compare it to something like Minecraft and you don't have the chance to build your houses on your own, rather then setting up predefined houses (check the wiki for more). Combat is quiet fun but not balanced right now, slashing weapons can do decent damage, but the bleed that can be applied to you is a death sentence, aswell as some heavy crossbow that kill you nearly in a single shot. This is something that hasn't been worked on since I joined the alpha, but I believe this will be looked at.Graphic and game performance are moderate, if you have a decent pc and you have some lags, it's because of some bad server maintenance or overload of objects on a map. The sound ingame is as right now clearly nothing special. Sometimes a sound is bugging and playing in a loop until you finally decide to restart your game. Yes restart, because reconnecting/disconnecting is not implemented yet!All in all I recommend this game for anyone who is a fan of survival, teamplay, medieval and is ready to invest some time into a game and not expecting to have a big giant castle on day two.Here my personal opinion in a shorter version:+A lot of skills+A lot of crafting recipes+Teamplay needed+Patches every second week-Soundquality-Missing guild/friend system-Missing longer roadmap (I like to see a plan cause it shows some "organization")-Combat unbalanced-Some Crafting recipes needs to reworked-No horses :(Thanks for reading, if you liked it please give me a thumb up :D

content:
Posted: March 22
												This game is one of those games you honestly hate for what it is. You hate that it is laggy. You hate how bad the game looks sometimes. You hate that the combat is janky. You hate all the occasional glitches and bugs. You hate how horrible it deals with some of the systems and character leveling. You hate how nearly every server is atrocious and has Game Masters who have no clue what they are doing. You hate so much of the game, but you also find it enjoyable for what it allows you to do. You find it to be pretty damn good with the right people. This game provides you a means to have great roleplay with great players; and some not to great players to where it can hurt, but we won't go more into that. This game allows for you to build a settlment of two or three people and live as farmers would. It gives you the chance to be a knight or a mercenary. You can strive to be a king as you fight agaisnt other players who have the same aspiration. This game can be really good, but only if everything goes right for what you want. If you want to grief people and be an ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, there are servers that allow it. If you want to have huge battles, framerate permitting, there are servers for it. If that's your thing, go for it. If you want to roleplay and have pretty good medievale life simulator, there are good servers. You will have to look a lot and deal with some bad servers, but you will find good ones. One more thing, this game is meant to be played with friends. The only reason I put up with this game for so long, was great people and friends I made and brought along the way. You will probably never enjoy this game without friends and good players to play with. Thus I don't recommend this game, unless you have good friends to play with. Also, do not buy this game for $40. Buy it on sale or in a bundle for like $20 at the most. This game is for a very small percentage of gamers who are patient, are fine with the grinding, can deal with griefing every now and then, are very creative, love to roleplay, and enjoy this game enough to barely stop themselves from throwing their computer at a wall. If that isn't you, back away slowly and never come back.

number of helpful: 8 of 12 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is designed similar to the MMO Würm.To those that don't already know what Würm is, it is a ultra realistic medieval simulator with tons of grinding and real life day efforts to accomplish greater deeds, Minecraft copied Würm and made it into a piece of cake for newbies ( Arcade )And today we have this game which is way more fast paced than Würm but also harder than Minecraft.The concept so far is great and I expect lots of features/content to be added through the development periode of the next few months.Pros:-Great Medieval Simulation.-Architectur / Terraforming is vital to be planned out ahead. ( No instant Minecraft houses )-Cooperative play is highly recommended as resources is a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥to collect on your own.-Bandits/PVP players gets punished by lossing more stats on death.-Great RPG elements shown through a very neat list of skill trees which unlocks upgrades along the paths you choose.Cons:-Animals are almost impossible to kill since a moose can take like 150 hits with a stone axe to kill and a wolf will straight up pwn you as you will not be propper quipped for combat until late game.-Server crashing and slow server list made the game very frustrating, however a few days ago they patched some of bugs which have caused a relative stable version. ( I haven't crashed in awhile now )-Combat got an animation but compared how they wanted to make it like Mount and Blade hit detection, it is just a prototype as of now and it is more like throwing a dice with a very low chance of hitting.Conclusion:Overall I would say this is a good investment, it shows lots of potential in its current shape and for medieval enthusiaststhat wants to experience a simulation of medieval life, this is the game there is so many skill trees to make you anything from a architect to a pope.I really recommend this game since it got patched against server crashing which allows you to play a sort of demo with limited animations but the gameplay is fluid :)Hope you enjoyed my review, get in the game with some friends and start building!

number of helpful: 8 of 12 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 24, 2015
												This game is complex, and it is not intuitive and depending on the server you play on can be very slow to do anything.At its core though it is what it says it is though, and boasts some great features buried deep within its context menus.In some ways, I am growing to like this as it does serve as a filter that caters towards a certain type of player.Like any game.. it has its fair share of bugs.. maybe more then others, maybe less, but it is being actively worked on and the developers are fixing bugs at a seemingly steady pace and most importantly are engaging with the community to do so.Talking about gameplay,This game is not fast paced, though can be depending on server settings etc.This game is not really good as a solo player, you need to be in a group or join a settlement to really enjoy it and to progress quickly and get the most out of the emergent gameplay that occurs 'in my opinion'.This being said, being a solo player is still viable, but you will not progress as quickly as a group of people(provided they are coordinated).When you talk about combat, having a couple friends is always better then having to fight and fend of an attack alone so as a solo player making allies would be important.If you are looking for a PvP orientated survival game that is complex, has RPG elements, takes time to play and learn, has a detailed crafting system and makes you look up a wiki just to chop a tree down this could be the game for you.This game demands time and patience,I recommend this game as graphically it is nice, gameplay it is ok once you get used to it, but I would not encourage people to rush out and buy it.This game caters to a niche type of player, do the standard research and be sure you are willing to put in the time, and have patience to learn and play this game.

number of helpful: 8 of 12 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 20, 2015
												The release went a little rough, but in the end they've done everything promised and then some. The release day bugs that plague many folks were cleared up just a mere few days after. The game is a great survival sandbox that REQUIRES cooperation, time, and patience. The grind is hard and long but when you finally finish a long project, its well worth all of your hard work. This isn't your typical survival game. This isn't like rust or dayz but falls more in line with Wurm than anything. Crafting, leveling up, and building are intense actions that can be overwhelming if you're not expecting it. So be prepared, Life is Feudal

content:
Posted: October 26, 2016
												Warning: more addictive than minecraft.This is not a single player game, if you're trying to play it as such, you're going to have issues, as it is a lot of work to get anything done, and a variety of players with a variety of skills makes everything go a lot smoother.But if you enjoy those games where you spend a lot of time doing the same sort of things over and over again for an end result, this one is for you. It's got a lot you can do in it, from terraforming, construction on that now flat ground, farming, hunting etc. and most of it seems to work fairly well. It is a bit of a learning curve, but after a few hours it does become fairly intuitive, you right click, you discover what you can do, you do it a bit more, you can do more things. I certainly reccommend this game, although do stress again, not a single player experience.

number of helpful: 8 of 12 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 8, 2015
												Okay so this is my first review ever, so keep that in mind.Also keep in mind, THIS GAME IS NOT FINISHED YET!!   A lot of people may trash one thing or another without realizing that this is not a complete product.  For an unfinished game, it's fantastic.  For a published game, it's got some work.  Things to expect: Bugs bugs and more bugs.  Again, this is not a complete product.  So yes, there's bugs.  There's quite a few annoying ones.  HOWEVER since I have purchased this game a lot has been done to fix these bugs and to improve on the game.  If you like simulation type games/RPG based on crafting.  You'll love this game.  Very few games come close.   I would argue some of the skills don't make sense when it comes to unlocking certain skills..  Like Tailoring is unlocked through..  Cooking?  ..  wha..??  Procuration is also a requirement as well as farming..   ?!?!?!    I think that needs to be re-evaluated.  However, the way the skills work in terms of leveling them up is great.  There's basically a few "Teirs" to skills.   0-29, I would call this untrained.  You don't know completely what you're doing, you can't do very much with it, and whta you can do will result in terrible products.   30-59.  I would call this an apprentice.  you know some stuff and you can do some useful stuff, things you make or produce with this skill is not great but you're learning.  60-89, journeyman.  You can pretty much do what you need wit hthe skill and have descent items created from it.  it doesn't take too long to get to 60 in most skills.  Once you're there, you don't really NEEEEED to go any further unless you want to specialize in that skill.  Keep in mind you have a limited amount of skill points so you can't do everything in the game (unless you're on one of those servers who pretty much get rid of the skillcaps)  Getting to 90, which I would say is master, 100 being grandmaster, takes time.  so, skills are cool, the unlocking part needs work.Combat is gross right now.   plain and simple.   The idea behind it though is amazing.  If you get wounded, doesn't matter if a healer can heal you, tha'tll just keep you alive, you're done.  Unless your suicidal.  This makes for a fantastic combat system where player skill mixed with character skill could land a blow that takes someone out of the fight.  Killing also shouldn't be taken lightly as you will loose karma/alignment.  the lower alignment you have, the more skills you loose when you die.  ALSO if your alignment drops enough, anyone can kill you WITHOUT penalty.  So careful.  People do have the opporunity to yeild.  I would highly suggest letting them live.   Again, cool ideas with the combat system, can't wait till the kinks are worked out.Crafting and combat.   That's this game in a nutshell.  Some people RP which is cool.  Either way, if that's someting you like, this game, once it's complete should fill that need quite nicely.  For me it already does.  I am quite patient with bugs however, and some people are not.  I reccoment this game to those who aren't always looking for action and like to craft and build.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2014
												If you're anything like me you'll love this game.I've desperately been searching for a community based town building game. This game has that with pvp aspects added in. It definitely has a long way to go but if you find a good server you can still get a very enjoyable experience even though everything is not fully implemented yet. The future for this game is very bright and even if you don't buy it to support it's development I would keep your eye on this game for when it hits MMO phase.Pros: The variety of servers available really lets you choose your own play-style. If you want to go alone and keep it easy you can choose a server with high skill multiplier (you level up faster) and a higher skill cap (so you can do more things). While if you're looking for a challenge you can join a server with lower limits and slower leveling (such as Camelot). For me, I enjoy the challenge and I feel rewarded when I finally finish building that project I've been working on, or that I finally reached that level I've been training for. EVEN if this game was to stop being developed today I know that with the modding community the way it is, and the guys over at Camelot server, this game could still be enjoyable indefinitely. Being a part of community and being needed for your skills by that community is an amazing feeling and really promotes the social aspect of this game. Cons: Unless skills are set to over 1500 max you'll need at least a few other people to play and build a community with. Some servers are poorly managed and it may be hard to find one that really suites your play style that is consistently up. The game is still lacking in may aspects, but it's in alpha and you are supporting development by buying the game like it is. If you're into playing solo or a lot of heavy action packed game-play you may not like this. If you don't like medieval settings or non-targeted combat (like chivalry or mount and blade) you may not like this game.My Alpha review is 10/10See you in game!

content:
Posted: February 23, 2015
												First of all, WHY THE **** MIXED REVIEWS?!   This is an awesome game, it runs really fast with maximum settings on my pc -- my pc is a normal pc not even a gamer's. This game includes an ininite amount of hours of variated and fun content, and it looks awesome. It's awesome, like minecraft hugely realistic and with epic^1000 graphics. When crafting each type of item it's like a puzzle itself, in an awesome way. When you finish a building you really feel proud of yourself, like if you had built it in real life.  The 'grinding' it has, it's pretty fast and you end up with awesome results. Spent 2 days and built a huge stone wall, all by myself -- Finding stones, Choping trees, getting wooden boards out of them, digging clay. Even though you might think it takes long to built only a stone wall, it really feels like didn't, because you don't built the entire wall at once. You build each section at a time and rapidly feel the awesome results of it. And not only that, there are about 30 different types of 'Wall Sections' of each tier. (Wood, Stone, Castle) Some of those are: Wall, Diagonal wall, tower, diagonal tower, gatehouse, wall with stairs... This game is awesome ! It is hugely immersive and detailed. It is slow-paced but it feels like if it was fast-paced after playing a little. I hugely recommend this game, for people who like RPGs. "To play this game really feels like being in the medieval era" 9/10Awesome graphics, fun, interesting, entertaining. And pretty hard.Has some minor bugs, but it's an excelent game. The bugs i've had in the previous version, for example a bug that corrupted your save files, have been completely fixed.

number of helpful: 9 of 14 people (64%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 6, 2014
Early Access Review
								review updated on 11/12/2014Where to start.lets start with crafting.it is long and tedious and the amount of time you need to put into it is amazing. it takes a long time to make everything work. to get to that first shack, to your first weapon, to your first house and beyond.This is not your normal crafting game. this is much more. I would liken it to Rust ( since i have played it ) but much much better. like 100 times better.if you drop something there is a timer before anyone can pick it up.when you die  you have something like 2 hours to pick it up. no one else can touch it until then.104.4 hours into the game and i'm just now getting the basic  workshop buildings up and i have a very long ways to go before i can make anything resembling a city. This is definitely the first Online game that i enjoy. considering how much i dislike these types of games, this one gets past my dislike because of how it works, the negatives other players get if they attack you.they can't just rip you off. well they can if you have a undefended village, but thats normal.Now this game is very much in alpha stage of development as of this review. personally for me. i think the current cost of $39.99 is worth it.But for a online game, i like it. very much.9/10 rating from me.Its alpha, don't buy it unless you wish to support the games development!!!!update 11/12/2014Keeping my review at recomend.Some new info after my time playing, since i wrote the review i had 100 hours into the game, and now about 430. took my time learning more about the game.So let's go and see what i have found out.1. The game has bugs, but thats expected. most are of the annoying type and don't really cause any major issues in the game.2. Game lag. this is mostly due to the trees and it not being optimized. if you keep setting down like draw distance on trees the lag is manageable. plus the lag spikes but sometimes they are as manageable and sometimes not. again, somthing thats expected in a game this early in development.3. Servers i have played on a few private servers and had a blast. until they dropped with no warning. which sucks, lost all my and my teams hard work. I'm not normally a online player that gets onto servers so i don't know if thats normal or not.4. Updates. there has been a couple since i got the game, last one added ability to put furniture where i wanted it. like in the house i built. so that's a plus. and sounds like more animals will be in the next one. so thats another plus.5. Combat. crossbows suck. the range is ridiculously short and they come before bows. the simplest weapon, the bow should be first., after the sling that is.5.1 Combat, Swords. now this can be fun, though with the tree lag it can be problematic at times. but once you figure it out it works rather well. take s a bit of time to find that sweet spot. took me many wolves and mooses before i figured that one out.5.2 Combat Animals. The wolf, it brings a new fear as you run half naked across the sands or in the forests. you learn why humans feared this animal for eons and tried to eradicate it off the face of the planet. freaking things are deadly. until you get some good armour.. then they more of a nuisance. but if you goof, they can still be deadly. as i found out while wearing plate mail armour. wolf hit me in the head and knocked me silly, he then proceeded to chew my intestines like they was spaghetti.6. Herbalism, the 50,000,000 million combinations thats possible. now this is crucial because you need flux to build the advanced buildings and structures. and flux.. if you're doing it on your own or with just a couple people. can be tedious to get ahold of and time consuming. but the more people you get, the easier it becomes. and if you have other camps willing to trade. then it becomes super easy.6. Plant Fiber and coops and making of snares. this one i don't much care for in its current state. plant fiber is very time consuming to get. because you only get 1 from each swipe. even with a team of people working with you, its still a chore. especially since if you want to stock your coops to get dung. well you need a ton of snares, and making snares requires a massive, huge load of plant fiber. i think thats the one major issue i have with this game. that and that coops don't really work yet. and the amount of dung you get off it.. is tiny, and tiny dont work if you have a huge farm that requires it.there is still a fair amount of content not added yet as of this updated review. but i still endorse this game. and i can see it just getting better and better.and a reminder.this is a game in development, it has bugs and issues and on some peoples computer. it either won't run or lag so badly you can't really play it. Read the system requirements before buying!! if you're close to the min specs. your not gonna have a 60fps, more like 15fps or 5fps.until more content is added that is all for now with this updated review.

content:
Posted: November 10, 2014
Early Access Review
								310 Hours played, a dozen or so servers.  PVP, PVE, Raiding, etc.- $40 is very expensive for a early access game.- Definitely got $40 worth of fun out of LiF- Right now the amount of fun you will have is heavily dependent on the server you are on.- There are servers with  house-rules and servers without rules.  - The skill progression of the game is completely different for each server as well as several very important factors, all tweaked by that specific server's admin to test those settings.- You need to find a server that will play at the speed you want to play, with the amount of people you want to play with, with the rules want to abide by.- The PVP is not broken although you will find swinging with a wooden shovel is not very effective when compared to a claymore and the hitboxes are a little iffy.- There are currently some serious bottlenecks with how much you can do to a server before it starts to get bogged down.  Cutting down trees and leaving stumps, excessive mining and building are no nos- Remember this game is an Alpha, and as much as you want daily updates with groundbreaking new material you are basically signing up for a testing job- All this being said, actually creating stone walls, metal tools, suits of armor, etc from nothing but what you find and build is incredibly satisfying.  To go from a naked guy with a handfull of cookies to the proud owner of "The Vault", a walled in farm, and the highest quality producing iron mine on the server (all while being constantly harassed by raiders) provides a sense of achievment i've not found in many other games.- Soloing this game is tough but i find just one or two other people is all you need on any server with a skill cap of 1000 or above.  Large groups are very fun to play with but some people are picky about which job they want to do.- I wont be like the rest of the reviewers and pretend to know whats going on behind the scenes with the devs but as far as my experience goes they have been great, Bobik personall replied to a question i had.  LiF sees an update every week or two.I heavily reccomend this game, but at the price its at its tough to say go and buy it.  If you are into games with steep learning curves, coop gameplay, building/mining games, sword slashing, or just plain living Feudal, go for it!8/10

content:
Posted: July 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								Allow me to say this first.The game is in early access, and is by all means flawed. There are bugs. There are things you will dislike. There are parts you mind find amazing, but sadly not yet implemented. All of this is present.But besides that, I do honestly believe that if you have ever shown a liking towards the idea of being a medieval peasant, who can maybe work himself out to be a capable warrior, skilled farmer or perhaps a prized alchemist, this might rock your boat.Let us first summarize the pros. The game presents and open world with other players, but you must not worry about getting stabbed with a nearest stick as soon as you find another human being. Not only is this forbidden on most server, it also has negative consequences. As I mentioned above, there are several profession you can do, and freely combine if you for example want to do basic farming as well as basic smithing, though such merging will prevent you from being a master in either. The game requires you to play in groups of multiple people, which could be considered a downside, but I like this feature, since it can create a friendlier atmoshphere, forge possible friendships and makes it feel much more like a medieval town that you work towards. The various professions have quite a bit of depth in them and all are equally important to the community. Very importantly, I find the developers to be fairly active and helpful, despite some fearing an unknown studio will fail. The updates are surprisingly common and you can also track what they are up to from a number of videos on their channel.Now about the bad. It might be very easy for someone to find the game repetitive, as you are often required to amass a certain amount of resources before you can focus on something perhaps a bit more desirable. To add to the injury, you will see a lot of progress bars, which might be fast, but are frequent. The game is not the most optimized in the world, though it went up a lot lately, and is surprisingly stable. The combat system leaves a lot to be desired, mainly in precision. This will hopefully (and likely) be changed in a later update, yet as of now, it must be mentioned.The recollection.The game has an incredible atmosphere, bringing you to the harsh world of feudal times. If you ever wanted to be a medieval smith, hunter, farmer, alchemist or perhaps a builder, you will find this game quite pleasing. The long time it takes to complete various tasks such as building houses or creating complex tools can be infuriating, but if you manage to find a friendly group of people with whom to work on a village and get to speak with them on, say, teamspeak (which is very common, no worries), a lot of this boredom will dissipate, thanks in no small part thank to having people to talk with as you do your things. With all that, the game deserves your attention and perhaps further investigation.And that is my recommendation.

												This is a game with lots of potential as well as already being a pretty good game already. The developers are quite active in the forums and are good at fixing bugs quickly. The game had a bad release with lots of bugs, but they've fixed a lot of them in the first few days, with more patches to come, which helps to show their dedication to the game. The one MAJOR thing is to make sure you have a computer able to meet the system requirements, which are quite high, as this is the one game out of the almost 90 or so that i own that i cant play on my computer, due to the high requirements for the graphics card. I would personally wait for a week or two before buying, so that they can hopefully get all the bugs worked out. The game is not for people who aren't willing to spend the first 5-6 hours just getting the very basic tools and starting resource gathering. It is a game designed for co-op, which makes single player virtually impossible due to the huge amount of time needed to do anything. I would recomend checking on the forums to find a group to join if you dont have a few friends to play the game with, as there are lots of great guilds out there to play with.

								someone went on a rant about this game - here is what I wrote in reply but was limited to 1000 chr.  - there is a review in here as well.  Running to work and don't have the time to tweak this - so here is raw.erh - don't support the game? so the patches are what? (the patch record sort of destroys your ‘argument’ about that) as for the game itself I have paid for 'finished' games that suck way more than this. That said I see a trend with companies releasing Alphas until ??? and using that as an excuse for never ending worthless game.  I do see improvements in this game on concerns I had and I do not get the vibe of being strung along.  Back to your rant about this game - I personally go by game play / enjoyment to dollar ratio.  $40 is high for an alpha but yet I feel I am well on my way to get my bang for a buck in game play.  The game has is quirks but again I have play 'blockbuster' finished games that suck way more and have given me less dollar value.   Those reading this on the fence - please don't let the review above stop you from considering this game.  Know this about this game – it is a GRIND… “you want to do this, well to do that, you need to do this first, then that, then that other thing and finally you get to do ??? wait what was it I was trying to do?” – that is this game in a nut shell, if you have OCD this game will be suck you in and you LOVE it and hate it as the hours peel away… if you are looking for a quick gaming fix erh, you won’t last 1 hour.  As for this ‘paying for this supports the MMO” erh – yeah – they made that clear to me… and take any franchise and guess what… do you think more $$$ went into make the last COD better or advertising for the ‘new’ COD – where did that $$$ come from – from you buying the now unsupported older versions.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2016
												Game takes too long to to anything. Build a tiny shack? Well that'll take 2 hours minimum. I needed to make a bow to hunt animals, so I need to level up my crossbow mastery first (??), but to make a crossbow I need a linen rope, then to make a linen rope I need to have my Procuration leveled up to 30... Which is leveled by hunting animals. So I hunt animals with a sling for several hours to make glue out of their bones. So after several hours of painful, glitchy and frustating hunting, I have my procuration up to the MINIMUM needed to make a linen rope.Well now I need to build a spinning wheel.... which takes a wheel and nails.... which I need smelting and carpentry for. So after about 12 hours I can't even make a simple bow, the weakest bow of them all.I currently own a tiny shack, a camp fire, two furnaces and a kiln.Keeping in mind this is with one of my friends playing while I'm not on and he's contributing to our little camp.For now, don't recommend. The game is tedious, confusing and will definitely require the wiki which doesn't explain a lot at times.I'm all for hard games, but this isn't hard. It's just repetitive, confusing nonsense. Luckily I play on a PvE server or else I'm sure I would've rage quit hours ago do to raiding on my little base.Will update as progress is made towards the game.*Update*My friend and I have since stopped playing all together. We finished with a decent sized camp. Played on a low pop server so we only ran into a couple people and never had any issues.It just wasn't for us. Between lives and work, there wasn't enough time to justify to get on for maybe 3 hours and maybe by then we could've finished a couple items. If there was a server where everything was speed up 5x, then it would've been a lot better. I always have an issue with a game where you have to wait 24 real hours for wheat to grow.

content:

Early Access Review
								GRIND is the word of the day here. This game is very deep and with more features to come will no doubt get more so. If you've played Wurm Online and enjoyed it, then no doubt that is the closest descriptor I can find for you. Very easy to lose hours working on your stats to be able to build a house. If you're interested in online play, then take the time to ask when you join a server to make sure it's a good fit for you. Some servers are looking to build and work on stats, others are looking at survival PvP. The only annoyances I have found so far are in the controls and the learning curve, although I love discovery myself and don't like long tutorials. IT would be great if there was a little more help in theway of game controls, hud, and how XP tree works. beyond that, the wiki is still growing and has been a huge asset.

content:
Posted: October 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								Considering this is an Alpha stage game, it is suprisingly addicting. Despite the bugs and fairly frequent crashes, I can't seem to get enough. I bought this game expecting to play a bit to see where they were in development and really play when it was finished, but once I started... 130+ hours in about 4 days and a few groggy days at work later, I'm still hooked. Think 'The Sims', 'Skyrim', and 'Minecraft' rolled into one game.. As stated before, it's not finished, there's still alot of features disabled and many of the ones that aren't are buggy or obvious placeholders.  But the idea and style of the game are sound, and it is entertaining. My biggest complaint so far is the server selection screen.  It is too basic. It needs filters and the option to save or identify servers you've been on. Overall, it's very promising.  I look forward to when it's finished.

												Hello, I, Ferrell also know as Kintok, personally invite you to bring a group and experience the full dive of the Brotherhood of the Wolf server in Life is Fuedal: Your Own. We are full Rp and Full PvP with upcoming PvP events, and gaming grounds for training. We are Noob Friendly with a staff on standby for teaching basics. We also offer a live map with a minute and a half refresh for claim and player positions. We also have a active GM. All structures are built with labour nothing is, or will be, spawned by the GM. We support experierencing every aspect of the game, including the hard labor. The Capital is located on the northeast pennisula if you have questions or want to send a dignitary from your group. We also have new hardware coming to update the server, without wipe, so our server will run alot smoother. We offer a Live Map feed to show player and claim positions with a refresh of a minute and a half. The live map is a separate web page that can be accessed from a cell phone, for the full screen players. The Live Map can also be controlled by the Admin, like taking out the player nodes for PvP. The server is also privately owned offering better service. We have a Teamspeak server with multiple channels for different claims (you can get the information by asking in the global chat on server). Any questions don't be afraid to message me. Looking forward to seeing new faces! Live Map Feed: http://livemap.soa-modding.com/

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								TL;DR: You will put many hours into this game before you see any significant progress. The game does not instantly reward you. You will spend lots of time on the wiki and in forums getting answers to your questions. If you plan to play alone, you're choosing to make the experience much harder on yourself. To get full enjoyment of the game, join a village. If you're looking for a relaxing game with a deep crafting system, the ability to create any conceivable design for a village (within the limits of the game mechanics of course), a challenging yet rewarding gaming experience, then this game might be for you. I'd like to first address the reasons I believe people would not enjoy this game. 1. You will not be instantly rewarded for your labors. It takes time to erect a clay hut, to construct a house, to build a wall. If you've played Rust, you're more familiar with the ability to simply gather a certain number of wood and clicking the structure you wish to build. In LiF, it's much more tedious.  The gathering process beforehand along with acquiring the skills necessary to even gather those materials are a discipline in and of itself. Once you do achieve the appropriate levels and gather all materials, you can finally build your structure, that is if it's on level ground. If the ground is not level, you must terraform. If you're not familiar with terraforming, this game is a perfect introduction. All it means is diggins out dirt and leveling out the terrain. 2. Lack of NPCs. This, in my opinion, adds an interesting dynamic to the game. It forces players to cooperate in ways they may not have before or have always refused doing. However, the amount of time and effort it takes to gather certain ingredients makes it almost advisable to establish some form of trade contract with another player to help with your experience. 3. Weak PVP system? Long story short, killing other players can be an immense challenge considering their abilities. For example, you can always run into a village in full armor and a two-handed sword and murder a player who's unarmed, and lacks armor with ease. Of course, this is assuming you have the appropriate levels to even wear armor which you have to craft and you can only craft that armor if you have the appropriate gathering levels to get those ingredients. This is why cooperation is stressed in LiF because you can have different players have various roles (blacksmith, carpenter, herbalist, etc) and you come together to build a flourishing experience. Anyway, I digress. Assuming both players are in a consenting battle, it won't be shortly won as the targeting system is physics based meaning wherever you swing is where you'll do damage. Since the game is in Alpha it's not always accurate. Of course you can move around and block and there are even crossbows to attack at range. And the game does not reward you for killing others. In fact, in a way it punishes you. You have a prayer skill which is measured by something called Alignment. Everytime you do damage to another player your alignment decreases. This means, if you die with low alignment, you will lose skill points and the lower your alignment the more points you lose. However, you do have the ability to invite a player into a "unit" which makes it so alignment is not lost during combat. You can begin to see how random death matches actually hinder the assailant and simply inconveniences the victim.  4. Bugs. If you purchase the game in this current state, you will notice bugs here and there. They do not significantly impact your experience nor does it take away from the game. All the necessary components are in the game and you will be able to play it just fine. 5. Intense graphics requirements. Many players including myself have to lower the graphics settings to lowest to avoid sluggish gameplay. But I have to say even with graphics set to lowest the game still looks great. If you can get past these points and are still interested in playing the game, I just barely scratched the surface. I recommend giving this game a chance to lure you into its creative depths and challenge yourself with a very intricate game. You may not be instantly rewarded, but the rewards you do receive are damn good.

								ABSOLUTELY BRILLIANT! Unbelievable how solid this game is now... and for such an incredible lofty vision, the devs have really nailed it for the most part. This one totally changed my view of Early Access games for the good. LIKES: graphics are actually quite nice, stable game play (no crashes in 30 hrs yet), breadth and scope of crafting, warfare, building, leveling up, etc (very robust features), the fact that you can't really play on your own - promotes team work and cooperative playDISLIKES: long long long long long long long long long load times. I clocked between 14-18 minutes to get INTO the game.Totally recommend this to players who like medieval themes, sandbox games, intricate and detailed skill levelling systems, laborious yet rewarding development of characters and their skill lines, have friends that like to co-op

												Hands down the best crafting game I have ever played. The main reason I chose this game over other crafting games, like Rust, is because this game has no GUNS. In my opinion, guns ruin most crafting games because that is pretty much what the game becomes about, finding guns.Lets play out a scenario:-Spawn-Create a camp-Look for a gun-Find a gun-Get killed by someone with a gun-Restart and repeatEven if you strip back the fact that this game has no guns, and it doesn't make a difference to you, then this game still has, in my opinion, the most in depth crafting system I have ever seen. Along with constant updates to improve gameplay, the UI, and add content.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 26, 2015
Early Access Review
								My boyfriend bought the both of us this game, and we absolutely love it.  If you're looking for a survival/crafting/sandbox/MMORPG that differs from the other bigger titles (in the sense of you really have to work towards your survival and nothing is handed to you or is easy) with medieval flare, this is definitely something I recommend strongly.  From hunting to carpentry, herbology, healing, weapon building, leather tanning, cooking, farming, fishing, war-horse training, animal taming/breeding etc. the list goes on and on and each of your skills open the door for another.  Spending the time to level them is key.  Reaching each goal is a huge accomplishment because you do numerous steps to get there.  Of course it's alpha, and there are things still in the works/being added...but hey, that's alpha in any game.  Being a female gamer who usually refuses to play a male character, xD  the fact that I'm able to overlook this for the time being speaks volumes.  I highly anticipate/look forward to the female models being added.  If you can play  this with at least one other person, you are so set.  Each of you can specialize in your own set of skills, and work together to make mad progress.  So grab some friends, chase a boar around with a pitchfork, throw some rocks at a bear, and eat♥♥♥♥♥♥you find in the dirt to keep from starving!  After all Life is Feudal!

content:
Posted: September 9, 2016
												This is one of the best games I've ever played. It's truly epic in scale and will require a ton of your time, however. You can't even begin to scratch the surface in just a few hours of game time. Notice everyone who doesn't give this game a positive rating, has like 1.3 hours in game. You cannot experience this game in that short a time. One of the main things I love about this game is the skill cap, there are a lot of area's to focus your character, but with the skill cap you won't be able to do learn and master every skill, so it forces people into factions and guilds where people can pool their talents and come together to form epic power centers, and that's what this game really requires. Once you have enough people together, you can create entire villages, and then castles, create armies, raid, pillage, go to war. Factions lay claim to territory, and I've even seen entire regions banding together, north v south, and battling for supremacy of a server. I can't stress enough how awesome this game is, but it is a time suck, it's a grind a lot of the time, but the rewards are immense. 11/10

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 19, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game is like the next Minecraft, but in 3D.  It's starting out just as funky and buggy and lacking, in my opinion, however I can see that it's turning into something darn great.  The only real issue I have so far is all the darn progress bars.  I don't really like them, I'd much rather have a minecraft-esque style of harvesting things.  By that I mean more live-action; if you held down left mouse button to harvest bark or search for things instead of just click and let a progress bar fill I feel it would be more engaging.  It could be something along the lines of every tick there's a %chance based on your skill and other variables that you get whatever item you're trying to get, be it flint, bark, etc.  And making it so there's little mini games for fishing and the like would be pretty great too, I feel.  Yet, honestly, that's really my only complaint.There are a few issues with terrain generation, yet I'm sure they'll get that smoothed out.  I mean I saw seams in the terrain where there was nothing but void beneath them.  It was kinda amusing, actually.  Similarly I'm sure they'll get more tooltips into the game that explain more stuff.  While it's great to have it like Minecraft where very little is actually explained in the game, the fact that the simplicity of Minecraft isn't there makes it so that things like descriptive tooltips and the like are absolutely needed so I'm sure they'll work on that as they already have some good tooltips in the game.I've never liked the idea of having to go to an external site or having to watch video tutorials to get even the basics of a game, I've always found that to be clunky, especially when a simple pop-up tutorial on the basics would serve the player far better.  I'm not saying that everything needs to be explained, yet the basics should at least be pointed out so the player doesn't have to stumble through the first couple of days wondering where or how on earth to get flint or rock.Overall it's an excellent start to a truly extraordinary game, it's beautiful, it's entertaining, it's engaging, and for being in alpha it's already impressively well done.  If you're not interested in the bugs and troubleshooting but you still want to play a sandbox-builder game with surprisingly beautiful graphics and good gameplay then this is, without a doubt, a game you absolutely want to follow and keep your eyes on, there's great things coming from this, I'm sure.  If, however, you actually don't mind, or even like, being part of the testing process, random crashes, strange bugs, and all that jazz AND want to play a game like I just mentioned then this, right now, is completely for you.  You can be a part of gaming history and usher in a truly unique and amazing game!

Early Access Review
								This game is set in such an immersive world that seems realistic (In its own aspects) to be a part of.  Its mainly not a game to be played solo, but rather with a group of friends or even random stranges.  Progression in this game does not happen quickly, so those looking for instant gratification should look elsewhere.  Though your progression is slow it brings a great sense of satisfation when you turn something like a hillside into a sprawling village surrounded by large stone walls!  The thrill of building up a force to move on an enemy emplacement cant be rivaled by many other games.  This game has a lot to offer in the present and promises great things for the future.  All in all its a fun and involved game to play and i recomend it to someone looking for a more adult experience to gaming or anyone looking for a good mideavil sandbox game! The community is mostly friendly and  helpful but remember...When all is said and done...LIFE IS FEUDAL!

number of helpful: 23 of 42 people (55%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								Life is Feudal, or what my friends and I have started to call it: Serf Simulator 2014, is a hardcore survival/build it all/kill the bad guy kind of game. It has been compared to Rust, DayZ, and Mount and Blade. To be honest, it does relate in different ways to all of these. You can build forever like Rust, the combat is very similar to Mount and Blade from what I have experienced so far, and you have to well...survive, like DayZ. Except no zombies. Life is Feudal seperates itself heavily from these in that you have to do every little thing. This can be tedious, but in my opinion makes everything worth it once it's all done. Building a simple shack is so rewarding and makes you feel like you've made serious progress. That's only just the beginning though. There is a slew of skills to learn, buildings to construct, and players to make relations with....for the better or worse. Every character in the game is a player, which makes the world either very community-like or very dangerous. You won't be able to do everything on your own. You must either find friends online, or invite your friends to join you. Characters have a skill cap and you must master certain skills to reach the furthest depths of that skill set. You'll need friends to provide resources from other skill trees to balance everything you work on.Anyways, I've gone on long enough. I do love this game and absolutely cannot wait to see what the devs have in store for the MMO version of this. Oh, and to top everything off the game has only been out a couple of weeks and the devs have already released three patches. That's a good sign for the future.7/10. This is purely because of this game being in Alpha. There are definitely bugs and glitches, but the overall gameplay is not affected heavily by them. I could see my rating going up with future patches.

content:
Posted: October 17, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game has it's issues for sure, and it is a bit pricey, but it is updated regularly and a beast of a timesink sandbox. Don't sit down when you only have 30min to 1hr to play.  You really, REALLY, have to work for everything.  I understand most people want to be done up in the greatest with a full base built in under 2 hours so they can kill another player before someone tells them it's bedtime, that's fine, play something else.  This game makes you work for what you want, and work hard. My friend once described it like this - "Man, if I get hungry and want a sandwich I gotta start an epic quest chain just to make the mayo."  And its practically true.  Though that's what draws you in.  Once you put the last shaped granite rock into your keep and see it before you as the rest of the server stands jealous, you almost feel nerd-proud, hah.The best thing I could say, is watch every video on it you can sit through and make Your Own (see what I did there) decision.  It is not for everyone for sure.

Posted: January 11, 2016
												One of the most innovative, interesting and exciting games that I have played in a long time. However, it is definitely not for everyone.This game is more akin to games like Shadowbane and UO: Online of old and the more recent Darkfall. I really feel like it catches the atmosphere of living in Feudal times. One must survive in a open, dynamic world that is completely controlled by players. One can choose to live their Feudal life as they see fit.A good deal of the game is crafting and building. Not only that but it takes a good deal of time to get anything done. For these reasons, I find that many are turned off by it. However, it is such a rewarding game for those who value creating one's own settlement and then getting involved in the world around them in whatever ways they see fit.The combat system is quite good yet takes a bit of time to get used to. Once you get used to it, though, you will most likely really enjoy it. It takes a more realistic approach to combat, where one must learn the range of your weapon and must aim at body parts for maximum affect. It is definitely not an easy system to master and takes practice to get good at it.The only drawback that it has is it is still developing and you will run into small bugs and issues that need resolving. I feel that it is a constant work in progress.That being said, if you like the idea of an open, dynamic, Feudal world where you make your own way, and you don't mind having to put lots of time to accomplish it, then I can say look no further than this game!

content:
Posted: January 9, 2015
Early Access Review
								It’s no secret that Life is Feudal (LiF) is not a complete game.  At the time that I write this, the game is still in an Alpha release.  However, as it stands today, LiF is possibly one of the best games that I have played.   I have played over 30 hours of this game and still cannot equip armour or weapons of any sort (my skill is not high enough).  Many of you are probably wondering how this is a good thing.  It means that the game is rich in detail.  You cannot start off the game and go out lopping off heads; it doesn’t work that way.  Rather, when you first start, you try to get enough to eat, scrabble together enough resources to craft simple tools, and then slowly (very slowly) you start to expand your universe.  I have never played a game that has such depth in the crafting or skill trees.  Sure, there is some grinding that you have to endure, but it is very satisfying once you have completed it and move up higher in the ranks.LiF is one of the best games I have ever played.  Seriously.  And it still has not been released yet.  Think of how much better it will be when it is completed!

number of helpful: 6 of 9 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 26, 2015
												So I bought this game on a whim because a friend of mine ask me to buy it too, and I did, and I did not regret. Beforehand, I read all the review that is people deemed most helpful, saw that it got a lot of bugs here and there, unplayable graphics, etc. And you know what? The first time I ran it on my laptop, it got shutdown my laptop right away when I'm loading the world from some server. Disappointed? Very. I could run Fallout 4 on my laptop albeit getting 20-28 fps so I wonder why can't I run this game? Simple, the optimization at release is quite poor. So I did what a someone with a brain will do, play it on my PC. And thankfully, it run greatly. No gamebreaking graphic bug encountered, which seems to be the main complain of most reviews here, no crash at all from all of my time playing this game, and I can play this game flawlessly albeit it does hit 22 fps in dense forest.So we have that out of the way, now what will you expect by buying this game? Firstly, one thing that you can expect is poor optimization, yes I admit the graphic is quite heavy even for my spec which could run witcher 60 fps with high 1080p setting, and fallout 4 flawlessly too. But it's understandable since almost everything can be interacted with, so the game is heavy because of that. And no, if you compare it to fallout 4, that game is still light in building things since you didn't interact with most of the game, just place things on the ground, while in LiFYO, YOU CAN TERRAFORM THE TERRAIN, my suspicion is that the game is heavy because of this, but let's leave it at that. So, heed that recommended spec before you buy it, does your computer spec meet or above the requirement? If yes, you don't have to worry a thing (possibly), if no, buy it at your own risk. Luckily though, the dev is quite fast on implementing fast hotfixes. Secondly, this is not a simple survival building crafting game, where all you need to do is know the recipe, have the material and then voila, it appears. Nope, you need to LEARN HOW TO DO IT FIRST. It got a complex skill tree where there're a few skill you need to learn first before you get to the skill you needed. Tedious? Very. Boring? Not so. Which is why having a group or making friends in-game is very valuable. You don't need to be a jack of all trades, you just need to focus on what you want to be, and ask for help for something that is outside your capability. You could learn how to do it, but it will take a lot of time, and don't forget about that skill you want too, it takes time too. Wiki and youtube is your friend, seriously. They might be outdated but they are still relevant as much since it's still the same. The only problem I had with the wiki is, it's not very complete as I checked it a few days ago, some detailed bits are missing but the general explanation should suffice, if not, check the youtube, there's a lot of let's play and tutorial for life is feudal.Third, The UI in this game is simple enough. There's status bar, hotkey bar, general info, chat panel, etc. You can customize their position too with F10. Also the cursor and the movement mode can be switched with tab. Like the name imply, cursor mode is used to navigate to panels, while movement mode is used for camera while moving and interacting with the world. The interaction follows Ultima/Wurm online. Whereas right click to something brings up the context menu, and it doesn't take too long to familiarize with this system. Right click on the ground and it shows a square tile which show how big the area will be affected by terraforming or what we can do with that area. It's not everything has their keybinds, but each things have their context menu, and you can set the default action to do something to the left click, so all you need to do is point something and then left click.Lastly, this game emphasis on player to player interaction, so roleplaying is what it is in this game. You want to roleplay a blacksmith? Go ahead, level up your blacksmith skill, then advertise your service to some guilds or tribes you found. If you're lucky, they'll accept you as their own or you get tricked or worse you could be killed right away, the choices is theirs to make.  I warn you there's no human NPC in this game, only animals and such, so there will be a lot of human interaction.tl;drgreat game, very VERY time consuming, you have been warned,not for someone who wants a quick/easy/simple/straight jump to the action-ish game,needs time to learn the mechanic and enjoys the game,if you're familiar with ultima online/wurm online or the like of it, you'll feel very nostalgic,lots and lots of player to player interaction,heed the recommended spec,no gamebreaking bug which I encountered so far,buy it if you like it and it's at your own risks

content:
Posted: October 3, 2014
Early Access Review
								First of all, do I recommend this game? YES!! I've been playing this game for a few days with a friend, so this is a review in progress. Let me start off by saying, this game, even in its current state.. is incredible. There's so much depth to it.. it's very expansive and there's endless possibilities. 9.5/10 Pros+It takes a very long time to gather resources and alter the terrain whilst building houses, and villages. That's a good thing. It makes it more immersive, realistic, and require teamwork. It also feels so rewarding when you complete a project you've been working on. So far, after 3 days.. me and my friend have managed to build 2 huts, a garden, fence, furnace, and blacksmithing station.. even though this seems extremely miniscule, I feel really proud.. like I accomplished something.. and we're planning on accomplishing much more. The more people you have in your group, the faster you can raise your village from the dirt. As long as everyone is working together of course. You'll never run out of things to do. +You also cannot specialize in all of the professions.. you can only specialize in 1 or 2.. maybe more depending on how you spend your points. So you will need to communicate with other players on what they are specializing in to fill that gap you need to efficently build your village. +It takes a LONG time to dig a tunnel+\- Combat? I'm a bit iffy on this one as I haven't had too many violent encounters. While the combat right now is in fact, buggy and the hitboxes are miles off, the concept is amazing and I think this is going to be improved. I got shot by a crossbow, in which I took off running and eventually collapsed from bleeding and then executed. This gave the combat many positive points in my book. As of right now, it will certainly suffice. But don't take my word for it, I've only beat a moose with a primitive axe and got shot with a bolt. I will update on this once I'm more experienced with the combat. Here are some of my nitpicks, or rather, suggestions on what it would take to make this game utterly perfect. -This is a big one. Currently, you need to specialize in certain equipment in order to actually use it. This is disappointing. You should be able to use any equipment, regardless of your expertise in it. Expertise should affect how well you use the equipment though. For example, a low level in Crossbow would make aiming shaky and inaccurate. A low level in Mail Armor would make your stamina drain faster. Ect. To not be able to use it at all is unrealistic.-When you die, a gravestone appears. This is immersion breaking. And here are some current alpha problems that are surely going to be smoothed out in time.-Crashing (a lot) -Lag-Bugs (of course)-Freezing -StutteringThese are all to be expected. But don't let them stray you away from this awesome game. For these issues to be present while I simultaneously give the game a 9.5, that means this game is GOOD. I can't explain it. It's just amazing. MANY hours are going to be spent on this game. :)
