content:
Posted: September 24, 2016
												I bought this game about a week or two ago and played some hours. (~90hours)I really like this game, it has alot of potential. I really hope the devs will continue adding some new stuff, and fix bugs.It has a few bugs, some weird mechanics(combat) - but building a village with other people is a♥♥♥♥♥♥ton of fun.Dont expect it to be like minecraft, where you start building and 3 hours late you have a huge palace.When you first play the game, expect to have nothing but a small flattened area with a furnace on it after 5 hours. It is really slow paced, and i mean REALLY slow. its more like a medieval simulation. Survival in my opinion is a little bit too easy(no heat/cold, no drinking, plenty of food).You will find yourself mining for hours, planting crops for hours, harvesting them a day later for hours(depends on rates of the server).But after alot of playtime, you just look at your little village and think about what you have done to archieve this. This motivates you to keep going and make it even more awesome. Add a wall here, some towers there, maybe a windmill and so on.29,99€ Is a bit much, so i would wait for a sale. But its definitly a fun game, and i got what i paid. (excuse my english, not a native speaker)

Posted: September 25, 2016
												First time playing. And seven grinding hours later; I have nothing significant to show for the effort and time put into it. And we were 2. Can't even begin to imagine just how many hours you have to invest in this game, to actually reach some sort of steady gameplay, not involving the tireless grinding required just to make a claim.If you have countless hours to spare, then this is a great sandbox-survival-crafting game for you! Very detailed indeed. But I would not recommed this game to anyone as semi-casual as myself. The time and results ratio alone, makes this game very unrewarding. First it impresses you with it's graphics and character-builds. And then; it crushes your hopes and dreams. When you've just spent 7 hours constructing a forge and anvil - with ressources gifted you by other players - only to hit you in the groin with the depressive realisation of not having an effing blacksmith hammer.Thank you, but no thank you.

content:
Posted: December 9, 2015
												When I first started playing this game, I played solo,  I had such a hard time figuring everything out, I had uninstalled it a couple times. The next day I would reinstall it and play more, but still not feel this game was that great, Reluctantly I played on a small server, I have learned so much and I am having a blast... LiF has become my current daily game! Its really everything I was looking for in a game, And no Stupid Zombies!My only real con to this game is the huge Learning curve, if you stick it out and get past that, this game ends up being a great game, and all the things you learn along the way, you will be like "why didn't I try that earlier...?"

number of helpful: 8 of 15 people (53%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 3, 2014
Early Access Review
								To say this really short: This game does not worth the current cost of 30 euros. There are many things that makes this game unplayable and boring. If you expect it to be anything like Minecraft where building goes, its not. There are no free building at all in this game. Every building, furniture etc is premade which you simply craft as a recipe. You cannot play this game alone either, or with "few friends" you need more like 20 people to get anything out of it. It's an MMO without the Servers, you need people to play it. Why you need people? Because there's a limit what you can do yourself, you can't do everything. It takes days or even weeks to get your first house build, if you dont have the nerves to wait this long, this is not for you.The game could have potential as a real MMO which its heading towards already, but as for now its all I just said.

												I spend a lot of hour playing that game and I can tell It's one of most beatiful and immersive sandox games in medieval I ever seen. Play with friends, find new ones and become a powerfull warrior or a rich merchant. The choice is only limited by your imagination (and server rules). :)Developpers are still adding new features, talking with players, and taking very good care of this game. A lot of potential and a lot of fun! You will not see the time pass.It's your choice: Begin a feudal life, your own feudal life... or perish :)

content:
Posted: September 24, 2016
												Hello Community,let´s start with the good asspects of this game!It´s an open sandbox game, where you can buid everywhere and change your surroundings. (100%)- it takes a lot of time, but you can really form a whole new area- only down side is, that the grass doesn´t grow back, so dirt stays shipped- building freely what ever you want (with the given stuff), some stuff take a long time do buildThe Crafting- mixed feelings about the whole context menu thing,- the skilltrees got remade, they are mostly logical now (expect some hick up´s in farming one)- Overall it´s interesting to doPvP / PvE / RP- PvP, fun but it need´s some fixing, (70 / 100)- different builds are availabel, no omny build (stats) seen so far!- siegwarfare needs some more tweeks, but is fun to do (85 / 100)- PvE, the AI of animals is just bad! (10 / 100)- in the early game wild animals are important, in late game, they just bother you.- it´s not too hard to survive in this game, never starved.- RP if your into that kinda stuff, there are good servers out there for it- since the game give´s you a lot of freedom how to build you can play out nearly anythingGrafic´s- since the D11 patch, a lot of stuff looks way better ( 70 / 100)- When all the model overhauls come in, I thing it will look even more nice then.IN TOTALthe game is good! If your into that kinda game. If your not sure if you like it, look it up on YT, make sure you got a recent video and watch some LP. Many people buy it and don´t got the point, what it is and start to complain....75 / 100 ATM
